review_body: I stayed here for a night before leaving the island. Everything was just right! From checkin with Roxy (a wonderful employee who embodies the aloha spirit of Hawaii) to the breathtaking views of Diamondhead and Waikiki, I could not have asked for a better sendoff from the place I called home for the last ten years. Come stay at this hidden jewel. You wont be disappointed! Mahalo for everything.

The Waikiki Grand's biggest advantage is its location. Right next to Kapiolani Park and a block from Waikiki Beach (Queen's Surf side) . The units are individually owned, so decor, amenities and prices vary widely. If you choose carefully, you'll get good value. They have a small lobby and a small pool. If you're banking on spending a lot of time using a pool during your stay, choose another place. The pool is small and cold.

Rooms are just okay, and depending on who owns and maintains the property, you never know what you are going to get. Our unit was perfect for our stay. Nice kitchen area stocked with anything you could want. Very comfortable bed. Huge shower. Laundry facilities in basement. But the reason we loved our unit was the VIEW - looking out from the 6th floor over the zoo, DIRECTLY at Diamondhead, beach view from the balcony. Unbelievable. Lovely walking to the beach, park or shopping/dining throughout Waikiki.

We rented a studio condo from a private party at the Waikiki Grand Hotel. The condo was so-so. It met our criteria for clean, cheap, and safe. The hotel itself was surprisingly nice. There was an entrance lanai where you could comfortably sit and watch the passing parade. The folks at the front desk were unfailingly cordial and helpful. The internet was surprisingly robust. We've stayed many places that advertise free internet but provide sketchy service. The connection at the Waikiki Grand was excellent. The location was ideal -- about half a block to the beach. On the 10th floor was a lovely terrace open to all of the hotel guests. It offered a great view of the ocean, beach, and verdant Kapiolani Park. The view of Diamond Head in the evening was very pretty. You could even look down into the Honolulu Zoo next door and see the elephants if you knew where to look. There were two elevators and one or the other frequently was out of commission. The hotel was quiet. If I had it to do over again, I might have rented one of the condos owned by the hotel itself. There was a Teddy's Bigger Burger restaurant off the hotel lobby. The food was good but the service wasn't consistent.

This place was truly perfect for our short stay. I had booked this place feeling like it would be a great match, but had seen bad reviews so I wasn't sure how it would turn out. Turns out, it was a fantastic stay. Our room was more than I could have ever dreamed of. It was very clean and a nice size. Our huge balcony ran the entire length. It was private. It had incredible views of Diamond Head, Waikiki Beach, and the zoo. The views were better than I imagined. I figured we would only have a partial ocean view. I was surprised. It was close to everything and so close to the beach and the strip. Staff was great. On the top is a massive open terrace for even more amazing panoramic views. This place checked every box and then some for us.

We stayed in one of the rooms that wasn't great. Really dated, bad furniture and badly laid out. But the place is great, great location, great price. We will definitely stay again, just not in the original room we booked. The lanai floor is awesome and plan to stay there next time we book. Sitting there, looking at Diamond Head, amazing.

I stayed here for 6 nights in November 2019 and was given room 611. The staff could not have been more helpful and attentive, particulary one staff member who was a older lady who i cant remember her name which i wish i could because she couldn't have been more friendly or helpful. The room we had was fine, Views were spectacular. You could literally lay in bed and look at the ocean and park while also getting a tan. Location is excellent being minutes from the beach and hustle and bustle, yet the hotel itself seemed nice and quiet and away from the hustel and bustle. Having Teddys downstairs was convenient and their burgers are great. The hotel itself could use a little updating but all in all it was fine. I would definately reccomend this for couples or small families.

Location was great, cafes and restaurants Was great. This Hotel could be described as tired! But the Unit that I had was clean and tidy. The proprietor had gone to great lengths to make you comfortable! The one Big drawback was the incessant music from a nightclub in the Hotel called “Hulas” The loud music and all the other noise that goes with a Nightclub appeared Never Ending, seven nights a week from 6pm until 2am.The management of the Hotel were very good and helpful and very friendly.

I can only rate the staff who were more than considerate & helpful to meet our needs. My husband became very ill and had to be in the hospital to receive fluilds for sickness. He was unable to get out of bed much less fly to Waikiki. I spoke to a staff member (Roxy) who helped cancel our reservations and reimburse us. I am most greatful since, we lost four days of our vacation and additional expenses we were not expecting. Thank you!

they will tell you there is a mandatory cleaning fee of US$60 per short stay after you booked the hotel. they will charge you cancellation fee though this is NOT stated. TripAdvisor tried to help me to get back a full refund but they just ignored TripAdvisor's request. do NOT book this cheating hotel

I booked Castle Waikiki Grand Hotel via TripAdvisor on 26 August 2019 with the following cancellation policy“Cancellation Policy: Refundable if cancelled 30 days or more prior to arrival, 29 days or less to arrival forfeits 1 night + General Excise Tax (including no-shows).”I then received a confirmation from Castle Waikiki Grand hotel advising me the following additional charges applied but it was NOT mentioned in TripAdvisor“A check-out cleaning fee will be applied to all bookings and will be assessed by the property at check-out. Fees are per stay, per condo unit, plus taxes: 1-2 Nights Stay Hotel Room $60.00 Studios $70.00”I therefore cancelled the booking on 6 September 2019. The hotel ONLY refunded me US$104.81 while they charged me US$130.99. Ronald Sugihara, the General Manager had more than 10 email exchanges with me but finally he insisted they will NOT give me a full refund.I approached TripAdvisor for help and they agreed with me that I should have a FULL refund of US$130.99 and contacted Castle Waikiki Grand Hotel to arrange the reimbursement but the hotel did NOTHING.If you want to have such a bad experience like me, go to book this hotel and good luck!

the room was managed by Castle and at $300 aussie dollars per night some TLC could be expended.The room was paid for in January yet when we got there we had to pay another $15 US tax that was introduced earlier in the year. The staff member could not tell me when it was imposed just that it was on the system and we had to pay it. could not tell me if it was retrospective or anything more.The room was clean and obviously the owner liked cars as it had an old gas bowser in the room posing as a fish tank - no fish- which was different, didn't mind it but needs to be cleaned - glass was mouldy. The vertical drapes controller was broken as were some of the slats; couldn't turn them. Spend the money and get them fixed.there was a coffee maker but no kettle so had to use that to boil water for tea. no toaster/toaster oven. no deep cereal bowls, no wine glasses. spend the money and get some!big screen tv with set to boxes to cable - no instructions on how to work it. clock on wall no working.big fridge comfortable bed and fan over the bed. air con good.also no safe in the room OR at reception. pool nice but needs resurfacing missing chunks off the sides and bottom

Not all the rooms in this property are managed by Castle Resorts and Properties. It seems some of the poor reviews here relate to the non-Castle managed rooms. I spent 8 nights here in a room managed by Castle and I was more than happy with the service and the room quality for the price I paid, which was around $153US per night all up, including taxes, service charge and cleaning fee. All toiletries and clean towels were supplied as well as beach towels on request. Plenty of toilet paper was provided and more was available if needed. Room cleaning/ servicing was done every 3 days, but I was told fresh towels were available on request. The double (queen size?) bed was large and comfortable, without any sagging and the sheets were changed when the room was serviced. My room had a full kitchen with cooking utensils, a large fridge, cook top, microwave oven, filter coffee maker and dishes/ cutlery. There was also a huge, curved screen HD television and two set top boxes with cable TV. The room was very effectively cooled with an air conditioner and there was also a ceiling fan over the bed. Some of the leaves in the vertical drapes were missing, but I located a stack of spares in the wardrobe, which I promptly deployed into service! The Castle staff were friendly and helpful. Honolulu Zoo is across Kapahulu Avenue. The walled section of Waikiki Beach, which would be great for parents with young kids, is a short walk from the property, as is Queens Beach.I can recommend this hotel, but please note that I was in a room managed by Castle Resorts and Hotels. I can’t comment on the rooms not managed by Castle.

Worst hotel ever. The air conditioner leaks water to the floor. Their solution was to get towels to the floor. The hotel has no staff at night. The rooms are very horrible and very overpriced. Don't come here.

Walk into the lobby everything looks good ,front desk staff friendly and helpful.Off to the room level 4 .A dirty blanket on top of the mattress no covering on the base of the bed(. Pull back the blanket sheets look clean (maybe). The window furnishings consist of vertical plastic blinds unfortunately not all the slats are there leaving about 30% of the window not covered.Bathroom layout has a different idea with the toilet behind the door a tight squeeze at best as an added bonus 3 cans of paint in the cupboard under the bathroom basin (nice)Take a look around the hotel. To get to the pool you need to walk through a burger joint (different).You will meet other guests wandering around with their dogs and partners.(Is this really a hotel?)Sleeping is difficult with lots of light entering the room, numerous trucks ,etc picking up trash ,dropping off supplies in the early morningDid I mention the nightclub on the second floor its only open to 2am?

Everything was as expected and we were very pleased with the hotel location, price and accommodations in Waikiki, it would have been great to have free parking but I understand that it's hard to find in Waikiki!

This place is somewhere between serviced apartment rental and a hotel and unfortunately they can’t get either of those right.I booked this hotel through a hotel booking site then made contact to request early check in directly with the hotel but had no response. When I arrived at the hotel on the day of check in they advised I could not check in early as they didn’t know what/if any rooms were available.On check in I was charged an extra $125USD for cleaning and the resort fee. I had heard it was common to charge a resort fee in Hawaii however this place is not a resort at all.The hotel room was sufficient. It had a cute view and lots of tacky fake plants. It took me about 10 minutes to work out how to work the shower so instructions would have been nice. To work the shower you had to run the bath then pull the spout down.The resort fee apparently covers things like beach towels from reception. I borrowed s beach towel and it was the crunchiest most offensively patterned towel that looks like it came from a lost property box. I felt like I needed things to touch it.The ‘resort’ has a pool - to access you had to walk through a carpark and burger joint and the three broken deck chairs were filthy.My room had a ‘kitchenette’ but no corkscrew. I visited reception and they said they only had one corkscrew for the entire resort so I had to bring it straight back. I was also told if I was expecting a corkscrew I should have stayed at the Hilton which is twice as expensive. I understand you get what you pay for however I did not think opening a bottle of wine would be such a drama.The hotels saving grace is its location. It’s at the more chilled edge of Waikiki and it has a cool gay bar downstairs. Based on this I would recommend paying the small difference in price and staying next door at the Queen Kapiolani Resort which looked a lot nicer.

Hotel 2 mins walk to the beach. If you are looking for a luxury hotel this is not the place for you. Room was clean and basic which was exactly what we were looking for. Staff are very helpful and knowledgeable. This is a fantastic value for money hotel and we will be returning the next time we visit Hawaii

Room was located on the 10th floor which has an open view of the Pacific Ocean and Diamond Head. Hotel location was at the beginning of Paradise and the rate was more affordable than the hotels that were located in the right and on the left. Room was situated with a full kitchen, spacious bathroom, king size bed and two chairs that were twin size beds. Six days for less than a thousand dollars.

Stayed here for 10 nights and couldn't be happier with the staff! Thanks Roxy and Jesse for all your help whilst there. Nothing was a hassle to them. Will be back to stay but not in a private rental next time. Thanks again.

We stayed here for a few nights, the staff were excellant - we had a room with a view of the ocean as well as the diamond head volcano, hotel is older but maintained well, very satisfied - the location was excellant, accross from the zoo and not far from the aquarium, and the beach was a hop and a step away

The only perks I would give this hotel is the location, it had a full kitchen (which we didn't use) and that they give you 1 free Mai Tai when checking in. The bed was extremely firm and made sounds as if it still had its plastic wrap still on it. Our bathroom wasn't in the best condotion either. You could see the mold on the tiled floors, the shower drain must have been clogged because it drained very SLOW! To top it all off with the bathroom, the shower didn't even have a plastic liner which we learned the hard way as we exited the shower to a pool on the floor, probably why the tiles were so moldy. Also during booking there was no mention of a $73.30 cleaning fee that would be collected at check-in. We did make a reservation through Cancelon a week before travel and selected this hotel as there weren't much options available but I can confidently say we will never stay here again.

Let me start off with the positive side of our visit to this apt had a great location. Looked through Home Away. We arrived at 1am a security guard is manning the desk pleasant enough but we are not on his registration for that location at which time he is trying to direct us away from the property a call was made to the manager of our unit got that sorted out.We enter the room, very dated but clean. Tried to open the patio door but it was unlocked and needed to hand to open and close it. The shower had a butter knife holding the drain open so water could drain and totally missing the drain lever.The air con unit is placed in the corner at a height that causes the air to blow at your face which was very uncomfortable trying to sleep. They were generous to leave toilet paper for 4 days for 7 days stay. Pulled teeth to get extra roll of toilet paper yaa. No table to eat at Haha with kitchenette go figure sit on the bed to eat. The end result is this property needs to be updated allot before charging Marriott prices. Paid extra for cleaningPaid extra for service got none of this. In my view this is max 100.00 per night.

patrons and staff are great fun, despite some patrons disliking the LGBTQ status and Hulas on 2nd floor - and i question why stay there if you are going to complain about this!!!it is very family friendly, close to everything and the views of the Zoo, gardens and beach are fantastic and relaxing easy to park in the Zoo parking lot for $1 / hour - only pay for what you use.

Castle Waikiki Grand #618.This budget condohotel is in one of the best locations in Waikiki, just one block from the beach and the famous Waikiki wall, across the street from the zoo and a short walk to some great restaurants. Being across from the zoo provides several benefits; the area is quiet, the view is great (if you’re on that side) and there was always parking in the zoo parking lot at $1.00 an hour 24 hours a day and 7 days a week, which is a huge bonus in Waikiki where parking is so hard to find and expensive.There is also a large lobby with seating and a concierge to help you find activities around the island, and restaurants if you don’t want to eat at Teddy’s Burgers on the first floor or Hulas Bar on the second floor. On the tenth floor there is a nice sun deck with tables and chairs looking out over the zoo, park and beach with a great view of Diamond head and there was a small pool that we did not use with chairs to lounge in an soak up some sun.Room 618 is high enough to be away from the noise of the street and the music from Hulas. The room was clean, we didn’t see any bugs and it is equipped with a min-fridge, a microwave, coffee pot and a hot plate with all the necessary plates, glasses, cutlery and pots and pans to cook or reheat meals if you so desired; but we never did. There are two double beds with sheets and pillowcases that were clean and sparkling white but with no spread or cover on the beds, just the sheets and a blanket. How hard is it to put a spread on the bed, even just a white sheet with a bed runner? There is a small flat screen TV and the air conditioner worked very well, too well almost with lots of accompanying noise. However, this room is tired, with mildew and flaking paint in the bathroom and the clothing storage was a rusting cheap wire rack, which however had plenty of hangers. There is a large closet in the “kitchen” area but it was locked, I assume with owner belongings in it. The bathroom has another cheap rusting rack, with clean white towels on it. The walls around the bathtub are decaying, and the paint is cracked on the ceiling, although there is instant plentiful hot water. There is no lanai (balcony) but the windows open (no screens) and the view is of the hotel next door with its rooftop pool, and between high rises, you can see a bit of the mountains in the distance.I think this hotel is in a great location but whoever owns room 618 needs to gut and remodel it; because it could be a really nice comfortable little studio with a little work. All of the staff members I talked to were very nice, friendly and helpful. I would stay here again but not in this room; but I would request an upper level room with a lanai facing the zoo, or a room on the sundeck level.

We stayed here for 8 nights , the location is 1st class one block from Waikiki beach , cracking sunsets from the ocean view balcony or roof top terrace “ if you book a roof top room don’t expect exclusive use of it as many go up there for a sunset drink “ our room was clean , it wasn’t the room we booked as in the pictures we booked this hotel as we thought it was as the pictures showed a full kitchenette , sadly not the case the desk receptionist told us we were staying in a hotel room and bookings.com had not passed on our requests . That aside we enjoyed our time here .. one word of warning is Parking they say spaces available no need to pre book , well take no notice of that as you do have to pre book , for 2 nights while a spot became available I had to park elsewhere at a dollar a hour , there is parking at Honolulu zoo but you will be lucky to get. A spot there depending on what time you arrive took me 1 hour to finally get parked up , popular place I guess .

I was really worried about staying here after reading so many bad reviews.. we booked to stay here for 8 nights as part of the last leg of our holiday.... we had originally booked a ocean view suite with a kitchenette, and on arrival when we asked at checking in if the room we had, did have a kitchenette with full kitchen ect ie cooker hob were were told it had.. on going to the room we discovered that it was not the room we had booked but a partial ocean studio with a small kitchenette which had. It cooker hob,it did have a portable inductor cooking plate which if it was just one person cooking for then it would be fine plus there was no extractor fan so when using it I was bothered that the heat from the pan would set the fire alarms off which was above the kitchenette work surface.I can honestly say I was rather peed off even though the room was a really nice room and clean and did have the balcony it was not what we had booked..When I went down to reception and spoke to the person he was very nice he did say he would speak to the manager too see if we can be moved tomorrow and they stated that bookings.com had not told them of our requirements, which I would imagine that would have had the same booking confirmation we had had and requirements. We said we would take that up with booking and made sure that we were only getting charged for the room we had actually stayed in not the one which we had actually meant to have stayed in.We decided that after seeing some of the rooms on passing them that were open and looking at the reviews we would stick with the room we had as it was ok. Only thing I would say it a higher floor may have been better as we was on the 5th floor and the bar was two floors below us which on a weekend could be loud although they did play some good music.The parking in booking this hotel states that they have public parking for guest and. I reservation is needed, upon arrival we were told we had no parking space as it had to be reserved and we would have to parking on the paid car park until they could allocate us a space, it’s cost us 24 dollars to park the car over the road from the hotel for 24 hrs as there was no where else to park and we had to keep driving round the car park for about 30 minutes waiting for a space to become free.. if you stay here ensure you email hotel to ensure you have parking on their carpark as it will be expensive. We then had to pay 130 dollars parking for the time we were there which we were aware off. I was also surprised that we paided a 130 dollars cleaning fee when booking and. It once during our stay did we get clean towels, which normally in other places I had stayed if the my don’t have a cleaning service they usually come in every 4 to 5 days to offer you clean towels... there was a laundry there to do any washing we needed to, but seen as though you have to pay a cleaning fee I would expect to at least not to have to wash the hotel towels and that they would change them for you. Thankfully we had own own towels too.Hotel staff are really nice and friendly and try to help where ever they can, the hotel is in a good location to the beach and shops and restaurants too, although it’s wasn’t the best it’s was it was ok and we had a good time in Waikiki it didn’t spoil our holiday. I wouldn’t stay here again.

The room was by far not the best for the price, got reservation from 3rd party at normal price and had to pay $90 cleaning fee when checked in. Asked for the city view room and got view of trash dumpsters and of other rooms (no city to be seen!) When we checked in house cleaning was in our room, went back down to tell front desk and they gave us 1 free Mia tia in the bar for the 2 of us to share, went back to the room and house keeping was still there, go back down to front dest and was told to go have more drinks in the bar (did not comp us any but for the one drink) decided to go walk to different bar and not pay them anymore of our money, came back and our wifi password was for a different room, had to go back down to front dest (no phone in room to call down) was told by front dest not to bother them anymore. We are deaf and CC did not work on TV, for the same amount we paid we should have stayed where I have before and not wasted our money on this out dated, run down, unprofessionally ran place.

We stayed at this hotel last week and it was really a great value. Good size room, well modernized, with a kitchen and very comfortable bed. We had a room on the 6th floor facing the zoo and Diamond Head. The balcony was great to emjoy breakfast watching the ocean.There is a bar/nightclub on the second floor, so I would insist on the higher floors to minimize the noise potential. It was not an issue for us. I would also insist for a room facing the zoo for a very nice view and sunrise. You would never tell that you are in Waikiki with all its high rises and hoopla.The front desk staff was extremely nice and helpful, explaining everything regarding the hotel. Unless you reserve one of the parking spots, you have to park across the street at the 24 hour parking at the zoo. It was $1 an hour, and you have to time your entry to avoid it being full, but it was not a problem. Plus you can renew the parking by text messaging, which is a nice feature.Finally of course, this is a great location, at most 2 minute walk from the protected beach at the Kapahulu "Wall". And 1 minute from a starbucks for those who need their morning coffee. And of course walking on the Waikiki beach and all its activities and shopping opportunities.The wifi network was specific to the room and it was nice and fast.All in all, I would definitely stay there again when visiting Honolulu.

i loved this location and will return here. The hotel is half a block from the beach and across the street from the zoo. I had a view of Diamond Head but more importantly was able to park my rental car every night in on street parking across from the zoo at no charge. Parking is expensive and tricky, and most is not free. BUT, some free parking still exists, and I enjoyed it when I stayed at this hotel

This was my 5th stay in 7 years to the Waikiki Grand, & like my previous visits it was a pleasant stay. The hotel is at the quieter end of Waikiki, across from the Honolulu Zoo, & there is a big Safeway store about a mile down Kapahulu Avenue. The units that are in the hotel pool are individually owned, so the style & décor vary from unit to unit. In this visit I was in Room 501, with a city view. The room has a fridge, 2 burner cooktop, microwave, coffee maker, toaster oven, with very basic kitchen implements. The room was clean, with fresh towels & sheets every 3 days. However, the room itself is looking a little shabby, so the owner of this particular unit needs to spend a bit of money to look after their investment. The unit really needs a fresh coat of paint. There are is also a hall runner, & rug in the unit which are worn & dirty. They should either be replaced or removed all together. These are just cosmetic improvements which would make a world of difference! There are other units in this building, which are not part of the hotel pool & the Castle Waikiki Grand is not responsible for their cleaning & upkeep. The city view rooms are in the back of the building, & can be noisy. I live in an urban environment, so the noise did not bother mer. In summary, I had a pleasant stay at the Waikiki Grand, & would stay here again.

My partner and I spent a week in this hotel. We had a fantastic time on the island however, there were a few things about the place that I’m not raving about. Our flight arrived in Honolulu early morning and check-in doesn’t start until 3pm (not an issue). They allowed us to store our bags for the day but when we arrived at 3 to check-in, they told us that our room had damage and we should come back an hour later. We came back on time to find the repair man watching basketball on TV in our room rather than doing his job. We were then told that the room needed maintainence and we were shifted to a new room (which was nicer and packed with a equipment and a lanai). I also had to pay USD $136 for apparently two cleaning fees but the first only involved a changing on bath towels so $68 for bath towels didn’t sit well for me. The hotel is not all bad though. The staff at the front desk were respectful and polite and the location is fantastic. For the price I paid per night, the faults aren’t that big a deal. Our flight home was cancelled resulting in us staying another night in Honolulu and when I explained our issue the staff were wonderful and gave us a discount rate for the night with no extra charges. Every hotel has faults and some are greater than others, but in the grand scheme of things our trip was fantastic and our room served its purpose. For the price you pay it is not too bad a deal and as a budget traveller, I would happily stay here again.

Just for starters they charged you a dollar for each coffee pod that you make yourself in the room. I have never been anywhere that charges you for the coffee in the room. There was no beside table to place your phone at night to charge. There is no phone in your room to phone the front desk if you have any questions. We were on the 9th floor and had to go all the way down stairs if I had any questions. It was more like a condiminium than a hotel, which was fine just not what I was expecting. When I asked for a wash cloth they asked how many I had. When I told them none, the front desk assistant turned to the person behind her and said very strictly, "Give her ONLY 2." We had a broom no dust pan so cleaning was difficult. We were promised to be delivered soap to wash our dishes when house keeping came around, but house keeping only comes around once a week so we had to wait a week to get soap to wash our dishes. In the closet there was a pot of dirt that clearly used to be a plant but was just stuffed into the closet. The sun deck they advertise is actually apart of someone elses deck so they close it down to the public. You have to go through a restaurant to get to the pool. They had given me the wrong code to the pool and then mocked me for not remembered the correct code when I asked what it was. They were extremely rude with every question i had for them and extremely not accomadating. They were sure to let me know that we're in the middle of audits or something and they "would NOT be able to give me full attention." The location is actually great. Just nothing looks like the picturs on the website.

We were given SMELLY!!! hole furnished with 1960 furniture, filthy and ripped cushions on chairs, the kitchen was also something to see. One wardrobe used for storage of boxes. It left a very dark shadow on our holiday.If you are unlucky enough and you have already booked a room, ask them to be taken to room 722 to view, it is an experience. If you are looking at the pictures that are on the hotels web page and thinking very nice, don't. And for the ones that do not believe it could be this bad, send me your email and I'll send you the pictures of our holiday place.

This hotel is a dirty place. Look at pictures. They let you pay another 65 bucks for cleaning service. service is horrible as well as the rooms. Pictures on website does not reflect the real room. Avoid when you can!!

This is a very affordable hotel with apartment like rooms. Customer service was great and very friendly. We stayed for 10 days and were very comfortable. We asked for a change of towels halfway and would have appreciated a little more frequent servicing but all good. The location is fantastic and we had great views of the lovely park and zoo across the road. We were literally 3 min walk to the beach which was awesome. There is a great Starbucks and ABC convenience store 30 secs away. Would definitely consider again and enjoyed this end of Waikiki as found it more casual and relaxing but also just a short walk from anything.

This place is closed to everything,you can found ABC store, burger king, restaurant,and cafe nearby.There is a pool at the ground floor if you don't want to swim at beach, but you need to pass bye the restaurant to enter it.This place is perfect for people who doesn't want to spend too much money for hotel in Hawaii,so convenient!Just let you know if you don't want rent a car then you can spend 5 dollars something for take a bus to anywhere a day,also recommend to see the flamingos in the ZOO,they are adorable.這個地方一切都關閉，你可以在附近找到ABC商店，漢堡王，餐廳和咖啡館。如果你不想在海灘游泳，底層有一個游泳池，但你需要經過餐廳到進入它。這個地方非常適合那些不想花太多錢在夏威夷酒店的人，非常方便！只要你知道如果你不想租車，那麼你可以花5美元買一個每天到任何地方的公共汽車，也建議在動物園看到火烈鳥，他們很可愛。

This place was a living nightmare. Was there with a few others and when we arrived at 11 PM after a long day, we arrive to a small, crammed, and disgustingly hot unit. Our AC was on and not working, so we went down to concierge. Well, apparently there is no overnight concierge and we were told by the hotel security guard, I'm sorry but you will have to come back at 6 AM. The room was hot enough to get heat stroke, and yet no one batted an eye and in fact they could not even properly fix it the next day. When you pay upwards of $130 a night you expect a basic decent room, but this place is seriously a hotel from hell. Advice to management: Invest less in stupid 24/7 surveillance so you can catch people trying to throw out their trash, and invest in customer service and a pleasant hotel experience. Maybe clean some of the hotel windows and get into the year 2018. If there was a 0 star rating, I would give it that. Do yourself a favor and spend a little more to not come home with heat stroke.

Though not the hotel’s fault-we booked a room through another vacation service, and had a terrible outcome. The manager, Ron, saw our plight and offered to book a room with an incredible view. We had an a/c glitch which was quickly remediated. Overall, we are extremely satisfied with the quick, attentive attitude of the staff, and the room amenities (2 bathrooms!) as we were on business and needed a place with no distractions.

If you come to Hawaii for hotel ambiance, this not for you. If you're looking for a reasonably-priced room literally one block from the Kuhio Beach it is one to consider. We travel for the beach and unique experiences and not for food. Burger King & Denny's are within three blocks. Get a cheap breakfast and spend you $$ on fun.This site wants the prestige of a hotel, but offers the lobby and well-hidden cleaning fees of an AirBNB. I echo the sentiments of many other reviewers that you feel ripped off when you get nailed with an unplanned cleaning fee that should be included in the offered room price as with most hotels.

This hotel did not meet my expectations in any way. From the moment we arrived service was terrible. We arrived around noon and they would not even check to see if our room was ready until check in at 3 pm. We stored our bags ourselves in a crowded closet where nothing was labeled and no one was checking to make sure we didn’t ruffle through someone else’s bags. The bedroom was small. Nothing like pics. Only one queen bed for two of us. With a big beam in the middle of the room. View said garden /pool and we could see the ridiculous pool and parking lot. Walls were paper thin. Very noisy. No full length mirror, no dresser, no closet. No phone to call front desk. No cleaning service. If you want anything you have to go to the front desk to get it yourself. And when I asked for additional wash clothes they made me go back and get the soiled ones first. Then wanted to know why they were so dirty and would not give me more than two to replace them. Ridiculous! There is also a public bar on the second floor of the hotel. Which is just weird. Staff was not friendly next time I will read the fine print and do more research

I'm a local in the island, and we have paid top dollars in other hotels, and The experience I got from Castle Waikiki Grand Hotel was excellent, friendly staff, its beautiful, yes its a lot older than the other hotels but the location is Fantastic, everything is right at your finger tip, its a serene hotel, clean pool, laundry room, elevators clean, clean parking lot, and very secure, and rooms are so comfortable, clean! I enjoyed my stay there and will be telling all my friends who live on this island to go there! It's a fantastic place to stay! And your check in is also your check out, do everything one time! It's great! don't have to waste your time and energy trying to check out! just be a great guest and everything will be great!

First, my son drops me off to the hotel and comes with me to the reception desk to assist me with getting checked in. The front clerk was friendly, confirms that I have been booked a room in this hotel and then notifies me that I have to pay an additional $63 for a cleaning fee that was not talked about in the email that I was sent nor was it made obvious on this trip advisor page. My son told the front desk that he had not seen any sort of mention of the fee when booking my room. The front desk person then asked me "did you book online?" My son said yes and he then told us that it should have been present on the site. Not wanting to argue anymore so I can just get my staycation started, I just paid the cleaning fee as I have already paid for the room. I take care of anything else that I need to with the front desk then head straight for my room to drop off my stuff and shower. First thing I notice in the room is that there is a paper bag filled empty bottles and cans on top of the counter in the room. Whatever, unprofessional but not something I can't take care of myself. I then proceed to take a shower. While showering, I hear someone enter the room without so much as a knock. I get out of the bathroom wondering who in the world is entering the room unannounced and see that it is room service STILL TRYING TO CLEAN MY ROOM. What is the point of me paying the cleaning fee when my room hasn't even been properly cleaned yet? It's not like I checked in early. Check-in was stated to be after 3pm and I checked-in at about 3:20. This is my first time staying at this hotel and it will most definitely be the last. The fact that I was presented with a "cleaning fee" on top of the price of the room and saw that my room wasn't even clean upon arrival is extremely upsetting to say the least.

This is a great hotel very hotel. I love the comfortable beds! The front desk worker Miss Roxy was very kind! She’s really sweet. Overall this is a great hotel and very nice staff members. The room is a nice size for 3 people

The staff at front desk were rude and difficult They tried giving me a room with a single bed and no air on or working lights when I played over 300US overcharged by the woman .The room was definitely under par small and muggy not clean or well kept up .They had tradesman come in my room while I was sleeping

It was a pleasant staying at the Grand Hotel Waikiki. It’s close to the zoo and just a 3min walk to the beach and convenient stores!. Thanks to Roxie for upgrading us to the ocean view room! It was amazing!

Booked in for 8nights and left the night we checked in as the room didn't meet the basic standards. I felt so uncomfortable that I had to find another hotel that night. There was no lights, bathroom was tiny and the bed was in a very odd position. My husband would need to climb over me to get to his side and the bed didn't even face the tv. When I requested to cancel it wasn't a pleasant experience with the receptionist Roxy and all I got was attitude when I thanked her "alright now, I'm busy" in other words F off! "Good luck trying to fibd a room now" well that's up to me isn't it? I'm shocked by the general rudeness. The only good thing is the location but this is not a hotel I would recommend to anyone and I should've take others advice on the page.

The hotel was in an awesome, convenient spot and the staff were incredibly friendly. In particular, Roxie (a.k.a the rockstar) was very warm, helpful and hilarious! I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends back home.

Stayed here in an owner unit which was a single and very small. Great location but the hotel lobby small and limited and uncomfortable seating. Nice deck on 10th floor. Construction next door hotel loud and early.

It's a collection of condos that are managed by the hotel group. So no big deal? Except the rooms are treated like an airbnb and you will be charged a cleaning fee. For me that was nearly 40% of the room rate for a one night stay. No mention on their web page or on the web page of HotelQuickly through whom I booked.The room itself was OK. Just about value for the original price but NOT when the extra $60 was added.

The location was ideal because it was literally a one minute walk to the beach. We got a good deal on a studio apartment, so it came with everything we needed. We saved money cooking in the apartment, although groceries are pretty expensive there. From here we could jog up to Diamond Head. It's located in a quieter area of Honolulu near the Zoo. We rented a car and parked on the street. There was a cleaning fee that I did not expect, but the staff was nice and the room was clean. I had to ask for towels, but them brought them right away. I'd stay there again.

Our unit was very nice. Clean and great view. We had a one bedroom with fold out sofa in living room. There were 3 in our party. It was large enough and everything worked perfectly. I would highly recommend this place to anyone!

I am not one to "crab" about much. I am usually pretty tolerable of many situations, food, etc. But this room...WOW. Be careful of which room you get! Check ahead if you can. I couldnt even open the windows, it was above all the air conditioning, and there was toiletries stuck under shelves and cabinets from the previous guests gone by. I was charged a cleaning fee before I got there, that I figured would ensure that I got a clean room. There were smudged hand prints on the walls, the floor made my white socks dirty, there was old coffee in the coffee pot. I tried to ask for a room relocation and they wouldn't refund or move me so I had to stick it out. I re cleaned my self. I'd have sooner slept on the deck than in that room. Between the noise, the dirt, and the lights glaring in from the outside hallway..it was a lot of sleepless nights. Watch out for room 900. Not a lot of pride was taken in the cleaning and prep of that room.

The staff at this hotel were always quite friendly. Roxy was especially helpful and funny, she only charged me ~$57 CAD for a "late check-out" which was essentially another night at the hotel (our flight was at 11:30pm, so this was amazing!). The location was awesome, less than 5 minutes walk to the Waikiki beach, there were also loads of bus stops nearby which was perfect for the day trips we took. I booked the room through an Expedia package deal, so I was assigned the room number/airbnb when I arrived at the hotel- I would suggest looking at individual rooms and requesting a specific one if possible. I ended up with a room that had no cleaning supplies or dresser, and because it's technically an airbnb there's no guaranteed room service (you exchange towels and get bathroom amenities from the lobby when needed). Overall a good experience for the price, but boy was the room sandy!

The studio apt at Castle Waikiki Shore was at the quiet end of Waikiki, next to the park and museum. Absolutely the best place we’ve stayed in Waikiki over the past 10years of biannual visits. We slept on 8th floor, no traffic or mechanical noise, only the gentle lapping of shoreline waves. Fully self catering, modern fit out with washer/drier, oven, refrigerator, full use of ‘Outrigger’ pool facilities next door.Ok for 2 people, they do offer 1 bedroom apts for 4. Good secure complex. Friendly, helpful staff 24/7.

I booked this Hotel for a week and paid in advance. When I got to check in I then had to pay the equivalent of £88 for the weeks service charge. The only service I saw was a change of towels once in the week. The room I was in was like some great Aunts spare room, except for the picture of the woman breastfeeding a child on the wall. The furniture was a mismatch and stained. The bathroom was dingy. This place was the worst place I stayed in on an eight month round the world trip. It is anything but grand. Seriously do not stay here. I had a kitchen but no kettle.

WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE I'VE EVER EXPERIENCED!We were charged a surprise 125$ "cleaning fee" upon arrival and were guaranteed that the money would entail us a clean room every 3 days. We stayed with the hotel for 7, and the room was cleaned once. i repeat, ONCE in SEVEN days... and lets be honest, every 3 days.... at a beach resort. gross. we were expecting once a day. I was screamed at and not given a refund.

We stayed in this hotel as guests of an Airbnb rental, therefore I cannot attest to specific hotel features such as housekeeping or other amenities. However, the staff at the front desk was always very helpful, positive and friendly. We had a late flight on our last day (9:30PM), but had to check out of our room at 11:00AM. We wanted to go out exploring for the day, but did not have a place to leave our suitcases. Roxy at the front desk graciously provided us with a solution for our problem, in which we are still so thankful! It meant a lot to us, because we were technically not even guests of the hotel. There is also a burger restaurant attached to this hotel that has great food and service! The laundry room in the basement is easily accessible with a code. We loved to go up to the tenth floor patio to watch the sunsets. Most importantly, the location CANNOT be beat! We highly recommend this hotel.

The Bad: This appeared to be a good deal when I booked it using points from Chase. Everything should have been covered with those points unless I damaged something but when I go to check in they want $130 for a cleaning fee. The site I booked through said it included weekly cleaning. They knocked it down to $109 but had I known this I would have chosen a different place because there were nicer places available for less. The only other complaint I have was about the hot water in the shower. Didn't matter the time of day I showered there would be occasional bursts of scalding hot water. I think it happened whenever someone flushed a toilet somewhere. I would have to jump out of the water stream to avoid it. The Good: Other than the cleaning fee and the hot water issue my stay was fine. The room is small and the decor is dated but everything was in good condition and clean. The staff were very nice, especially Roxy..who was very friendly and good about making me feel very welcome. Its located very close to the beach. There is a gay bar (everyone's welcome though) on the second floor which was fun. Overall: The cleaning fee makes it not worth it for a short stay. If you're going for a month or so maybe its worth it. I wanted to like this place but that fee is way too high.

Save your money! Great location, scenic views, but management that lies and rooms that flood.At first, the unit seemed great. Our first day went smoothly, staff was nice, views of Diamondhead and right across from the Honolulu Zoo! However, when night came, everything changed.The shower was clogged. We called maintenance and they came to fix it same day. But, what they ended up doing was removing the entire cover to the bathtub overflow drain. The interior of the hotel wall was exposed and every time we showered, water would pour into it. We let the front desk know every day as we didn’t want future damage to happen to the unit that would be costly to repair.The A/C was leaking into a bucket that was placed outside on the balcony, but that didn't stop it from coming into our room! Half of our room was ‘off limits’ because the floor would be soaking wet from the a/c leakage. It was a basic standard room with a king bed…so not very big. Again, we told the front office every day but all they did was place towels over it. We asked to be moved to another room but were continually told nothing was available.The Friday before we left, we did our daily reminders (a/c leaking, bathtub overflow drain exposed) and had (what we thought) was the pleasure to speak to Roxy. She was nice and finally got us into a new room. She had told us that we needed to bring up these issue with Hotwire as we were very unhappy with our stay and wanted some compensation back for the 7 days we had to deal with a flooded room. She said that management would agree to whatever Hotwire requested. She lied! When speaking with Hotwire, they said they would have gladly refunded the money as long as the hotel agreed to it. When they spoke with Roxy, she said they wouldn’t refund anything! Not even partial! Hotwire couldn’t withhold the funds since they were already sent to the hotel.We basically paid over $700 to stay in a flooded room. I even have pictures and sent it to management and Hotwire! I will never book here again, no matter how appealing the price point may seem. I guess you really get what you pay for.

I spent all the $ i had to fly to Oahu from another island to pick up my moms remains so I could take her to Kauai to be laid to rest... I secured a room at this hotel , but, the website I booked through never told me there would be extra fees to pay when I checked in... I was out of money! "ROXY" @ the front desk was sooo kind & understanding. She helped me instead of turning me away... for that I am absolutely grateful. We need more people like "ROXY" working customer service positions. Thank you!

Took a chance and rented a three night stay through Home Away.com. Was very pleased with accommodations and staff made every effort to meet our needs. Staff at front desk (especially Roxy) treated us like old friends. Warm and welcoming.

We loved our time at Castle Waikiki shores. Our room was large , well equipped and clean. The location could not be better. Beautiful views from our balcony with our morning coffee. A short walk to all the shops and restaurants and best of all just walk out the back stairs to Waikiki beach

Roxy and Gary made us feel very welcomed and like family. Our room never had bugs and was right by beach. I even got the courage to play the piano. Roxy was like an aunty I never had. Gary was the nicest man. When we come back we plan to stay here again.

I just spent over a week at the Castle Waikiki Grand Hotel and had an absolutely fantastic time! This place has lots of character and charm, and is not your typical hotel. It's not a massive, impersonal tower, but rather a throw-back to a different era with inviting open spaces, from the lobby with the nightly piano player, to the roof deck with probably the best views in Honolulu. Every single staff person I interacted with was super kind and helpful. My unit (#515) was perfect, with a comfortable bed, a huge TV, nicely decorated, super fast internet, and a kitchenette with a large fridge which allowed me to eat in whenever I wanted. The best part was the lanai with spectacular views of Diamond Head, Honolulu Zoo, Kapiolani Park, and the postcard perfect beach (half a block away). You can see the flamingos and hear the monkeys from the zoo in the mornings if you're sitting in the lanai. On Sunday, there were Hawaiian families having picnics in Kapiolani Park with impromptu hula dancing (and I didn't see any tourists). This place is all about location. You're at the edge of urban Waikiki / Honolulu behind you (with tons of great restaurants, hotels with shows, museums, theater, shops, etc..), but with unobstructed views of a tropical paradise in front of you. There is a newly installed bike share station a block away, which I used daily to ride around Diamond Head and along the beautiful coast. The neighborhood is super clean and safe, making long walks (even at night) very enjoyable. The weather during the first week of August was super comfortable with low humidity, constant trade winds, and best of all, zero mosquitoes. This place is truly a gem and I highly recommend it!

Me and a friend made a spontaneous decision to come to Hawaii and upon arriving had no place to stay. We came across the Castle Waikiki Grand and we could not have been more lucky! Many other hotels turned us down because we arrived so late but Roxy was kind enough to book us a room, and a nice one at that! She really made our night and helped start off our trip right!

This is not your typical hotel where it is staffed 24/7, it's actually a condo building that rents rooms like a hotel. We arrived extremely late d/t airline delays. We called to notify staff that we were on our way. There was no staff but a security guard who basically told us if the staff put our paperwork out we would have a room but if not-we were on our own. Luckily he had our paperwork, thus a room. I had arranged for parking. Not only did I call two days after I made the reservation to confirm, I also called two days prior to travel to confirm a space for two days. When we got there-NO PARKING SPACE! We did not get it until about 1pm the next day. Now about room 406. Hands down the most disappointing room I have ever stayed in. I'm ok with "dated" but this room went beyond that. Everything it was furnished with what looked like things taken off of a street corner: chipped shelves, dirty walls, disgusting grout, rusted fridge, remnants of poor repair work after poor repair work. It was so bad we were actually concerned about bed bugs. Nothing shabby/chic about this place. Just shabby. And forget about a "city view." Our view was of buildings butted up to each other and dumpsters. You also get hit with a cleaning fee when you leave. Ridiculous! They do not clean your room everyday and seem alarmed if you ask for new linen. Their beach towels are practically rags. At least the ones we got. The staff was nice enough but disorganized when we had to interact with them. It just didn't seem like they knew what was going on. It is close to the beach. I would say that is the only good thing. There are many other hotels around that are close to the beach as well and seem nicer and probably could get for the same price. Do your homework. I hate to leave such a damning review but, it just has to be said. We were there visiting friends that live in Honolulu and they were so disappointed. Luckily we were only there for two days. Do yourself a favor. Stay elsewhere!

I would like to commend Roxy on going above & beyond in assisting my husband & I in booking an extra room.The room we are currently occupying has proved too small for 3 adults. On deciding to book an extra room, Roxy addressed our issue with rapid speed along with a smile on her face.Yours sincerely,Harriet & Michael Redmond

I stayed here for a month and I really enjoyed it. This place is very close ,maybe 3 minutes walk from the sandy Waikiki beach, y cverlose also bus stops, shops and other truorist attraction. We usually had pionoist playing at the evening time on the piano. The view from the sunroof is amazing to the diamand head and to the pacific ocean. It has a bar on the second floor what had live music, alos a burger place on the ground floor. It also can provide car parking places and loundry facilities. My room was quiet, with all mod con and nice view. I met only friendly people on my stay and I really enjoyed as it is walking distance from touristy but also from quiet places as well (park, zoo, hikes, beaches etc) I also would like mention Roxy, the smiley receptionist, who always made my day, and was so helpful! So I can recommend this place for families, people with dogs, single people, and for everyone who wants to have a lovely time! :)

We stayed 3 days , 2 nights at the Grand hotel - as the taxi rank supervisor said at the airport - "it may have been grand once". The rooms are small with just a bed, no chairs or space for chairs inside just on the tiny balcony overlooking the back of another block and maintenance area. The aircon was extremely noisy and situated 2 foot from one side of the bed - so one person very cold and both people kept awake. The wardrobe was just a metal pole held up by wood screwed to the side of the gap. To pay the price for this room with no service then to be charged $1 dollar for an additional coffee bag makes no sense. The curtains were so thin that at night the lights from outside shone in like daylight. You could not open curtain the daytime as people from block opposite could see in. The option of change of towels could have been offered as only one bath towel per person was in the room. The free MaiTai on arrival at Hulas was appreciated but not a bar that was family friendly and we did not revisit. The whole place looks tired and the conversions and refurb seems to have been done by a handyman - bathroom door used to be a sliding door just rehung as a regular door and repainted. The price was cheaper than other hotels in Waikiki at the time of booking, but initially did not include the very high cleaning fee of $US 95. However in hindsight I can see why it was cheaper..I would not return again - I would prefer to spend extra and get full service, decent facilities, a quiet and tastefully furnished room and much more positive memories. The staff were pleasant and friendly and the location was central, however......

So typical to get great web deal and find that final price does not include "government fees and taxes" that will be added by hotel. This hotel additional fees include $25 reservation fee and $50 cleaning fee; don't see how these fees are related to governmentmtax and fees. With ease and convenience of web ordering, for hotel industry to contiue this type of pricing practice adding fees is deceptive and misleading.

My wife and I visited Honululu on our honeymoon and stayed at this hotel via airbnb.Having never been to Honululu before we were a little sceptical as the price seemed a whole lot cheaper than hotels in the area, how wrong we were.The hotel itself is directly opposite the zoo, about 30 seconds walk from the beach with restaurants and bars no further than 5 minutes walk away. There's a gay bar in the hotel itself, on the second floor, which, even though we never visited, seemed lively and fun until the early hours of the morning. There's a really tasty burger joint on the foyer level of the hotel which serve some huge burgers but it is very busy!If you walk up away from the beach you'll find back street Hawaiian restaurants and bars which aren't very touristy but along the beachfront there's plenty of souvenir shops, bars and restaurants along with a mall about 20 minutes walk from the hotel. The beach is beautiful but a little narrow so in the peak months could get very crowded, we found no issues.The bus stop to diamond head and ala moana mall is a 10 second walk from the hotel towards the beach and run fairly irregularly but easy enough to navigate around. The 23/4 will take you outside diamond head and I believe it was the 8 to ala moana mall?All in all I would stay at this hotel again as for our needs, which included sleeping, washing and getting changed, the hotel was perfect. If you're looking for luxury or child friendly then you'll probably want something elsewhere. For a holiday/honeymoon with a budget this is a perfect location on a paradise isle!

Not a hotel ,as advertised on bookings .com more like Air b&b .Total disappointment ,especially after travelling all the way from the UK .ROXY on the front desk is FANTASTIC. SHOULD NOT BE ALLOWED TO CALL ITS SELF A HOTEL

From the start, my booking was going to be a big mistake. Expedia Deceived from the start:[June 16, 2017EXPEDIA DECEIVES, MISLEADS -- NEVER PATRONIZE EXPEDIA AGAIN.I just returned from a week in Honolulu --  Flights,Transfers, & Hotel via Expedia [I cannot find a way to do Yelp nationally, so have to do it via a local office -- want the local folk to send it up to the real suits wherever Expedia does its business nationally]. The "Hotel" turned out to be a privately owned condo, in a place called the Castle Waikiki Grand Hotel.  A misnomer if there ever was one.  1. That was the first lie, deception by EXP.2. It was substandard, it did not provide what was described. [I will write a separate Review for the condo.] 3.EXP snuck it in with the real hotels on its webpages 4. Therefore, the price was not at a discount for a missing-service and missing-amenities package. So one pays full whack for what can be described as a hostel, not a hotel.  I have cancer and congestive heart failure, am a disabled veteran as well... I expected at least to have purchased a hotel room and its expected ambience.  I got an uncomfortable, depressing, grimmy miniscule room.  I think folk who have been cheated and lied to by  EXP should enact a class action law suit.  I would join. ]The Receptionists could be friendly, but they let inquirers, Guests or not, cut in line. You could be politely standing awaiting your turn and they would deal with someone who came after you. You do not want to appear rude, so you let it slide. Not very good customer service to the polite person. It turned out Studios in this “Grand” “hotel” are privately owned [SURPRISE!] so if the owner allows fabric and furnishings to go Derelict, you have no recourse. A proper hotel-ambience – which is what you paid for – was not there. Expedia is the one you have to ultimately complain to, and when you are on holiday, who wants to go that distance. These discrepancies and inadequacies, and the “management” : 1. the Shower lack of drainage left you standing in dirty water, despite calling it to their attention;2. they did not change the Sheets even the one day they said they would [I know my own stains, the ones I had to put up with the whole week];3. they did not Clean the room properly, as there was the same Screw on the floor after they declared a cleaning-day, and the floor constantly felt gritty though I never went in the sand – a $145 cleaning fee for this!;4. Air Conditioner worked, but it was less than two feet from your head… so the noise and the chill was like sleeping in a refrigerator;5. you looked out directly onto the next Building and the Parking Lot – what City Scene did you pay for! – it was a total lie, by Expedia;6. the Noise just 2 – 3 stories below, of delivery Trucks, their horns, their back-up alarms at 0330 was evident right next to your floor-to-ceiling jelousy windows, right next to your bed;7. the Curtains were of the variety that let in light 24/7 from 7 stories of neighboring buildings;8. the Hallway was being painted, [with a nice mural, yes] but only 1 day that week, so the splattered paper over the total hall floor would be there seemingly forever – a small point, but one which Expedia did not inform of – so your “hotel” was in a constant state of construction. Did Expedia give a discount, as a reputable seller would do?9. A sign: “Leave Kindle Here” – it was not there from the start, so would the poor Guest be blamed? 10. The Toilet seat was obviously in need of replacement, the door Chain Lock had been unslightly torn from the wall and left dangling, with holes in the frame … they left these to me, the paying Guest, to have to take up with the “management”. Thanks for a normal holiday, Expedia.This was a sloppy, bush-league operation from the start. To think, a supposedly reputable agency like Expedia would make someone pay for this “Grand” “hotel”. It is a shameful way for them to operate. If I did not have Cancer and Congestive Heart Failure, and Veterans Disability as well– which made me seek some nice peaceful holiday to begin with – I would want to take Expedia to small claims court. But it would be David vs Goliath.

the location was excellent. the hotel itself was just ok. we booked our room with an small kitchen with a city view. we assumed it automatically had a balcony. the room was tiny with no where to sit except the bed. there were 2 stools in the tiny kitchen area but seeing as my husband is 6"4 he didn't dare try to sit on one incase he broke it. kitchen was adequately equipped including a small cooler to chill bottled wine but no toaster. We had no balcony and our city view was of the parking lot out back. it should also be made clear that the bar/grill on the second floor, Hulas, is actually a gay bar and even though you are given a complimentary drink voucher its best to avoid it if you are looking for a classy family place to dine. my husband and I have lots of gay friends but we had one drink in there and never went back. my idea of paradise is not sitting watching the 2 guys on the small stage singing and then start groping each other. Roxy on front desk was amazing, she made our stay so much better. she knew our names and was waiting for us to arrive. every day she waved and chatted with us. I would stay at this hotel again purely for the location that its in and also to see Roxy's smiling face again. don't expect clean towels or rooms cleaned though, I had to go hunting for towels after a few days and request the floor to be swept. staying at a beach hotel with wooden floors sand was everywhere and no brush to sweep it up not that I want to be doing this on my dream vacation

I want to start by saying that when we first booked this hotel, we had read some bad reviews. After months of looking this was the best option for my family- I needed a kitchenette to cook some during our two week stay. We got two rooms- a simple hotel room for the kids (18 & 20) and a city view kitchenette for us. I am not sure how anyone thought negatively of this hotel!!! Is it the fanciest? No but when in Hawaii you should not be in your hotel much anyway. The staff was so nice. We arrived really early and they graciously held our bags so we could play at the beach until the rooms were ready. Roxie, who works most evenings was so gracious & sweet. Helped us with anything we needed. She even made it work for us all to be in one room with a late check out (small fee) so we could play the full day till our plane left at night.The rooms were clean and nice sizes. The kids' was simpler with two full beds, a tv, AC, big windows that open, decent bathroom, fridge, microwave & coffee maker. They had their own sanctuary!! Good for us too!! Our room was perfect for our 12 day stay. King size bed, futon couch, tv, small table & chairs, little kitchenette with a full size fridge, microwave, small stove & coffee maker, oh and AC. Every morning we slid open the big windows & propped open the door- creating a wonderful tradewind cross breeze to relax in. There was enough room for the kids to be there when they wanted.Location? Maybe a half block from Queens Beach...maybe. 5 minutes and you're sitting in the sun or swimming. Zoo is right across the street which the kids enjoyed. Want to take a drive? Being on the outskirts of Waikiki, you can easily get in & out on Kapahulu. Easy walking distance to stores & restaurants. Oh have to make sure I mention the 10th floor! You can sit up there and enjoy an amazing view! Pictures below...I would stay here again hands down! If you are very picky & expect hoity toity then this is not the place for you. If you are looking for a good, clean place to stay with true aloha hospitality... book today!!- Maria

While I think the term 'hotel' is a bit generous, this venue is certainly in a convenient location right near the beach at Waikiki, directly across from Honolulu Zoo.As other reviews describe, you will be required to pay an additional cleaning/service fee on check in. Don't be fooled - this doesn't mean that your room will be cleaned or serviced; you are essentially paying so that the room will be re-set at the end of your stay ready for the next guest.I stayed for a full two weeks so I found it inconvenient that linen changes were not available. When I inquired about the possibility of fresh sheets I was met with some resistance at the reception counter, because they were reluctant to assist me. It ended up being easier to use the laundry room and wash the bed linen and towels myself using coin operated washers and dryers - clearly this is below the standard expected of a 'hotel', or even Airbnb homes. I was quite surprised considering the price, which was not cheap.However, if you agree to this in advance and you're willing to fend for yourself a bit, the room itself was comfortable, the air conditioning and tv worked well, and the kitchenette with full size refrigerator means you can prepare my own meals rather than eating out all the time.The gay club on level 2 is welcoming and has a great lunch menu every afternoon.Avoid the burger place on the ground floor - rude service and questionable hygiene.

When I arrived at the hotel, I was asked to pay for extra cleaning fee for my stay despite having paid the full price at the time of reservation online. Ironically, the room was not clean at all. There were hairs from other guests' stay. They did not leave any soaps or shampoo. They opened the door and walked into my room several times when I responded them to wait a minute when they knocked on the door. Even when I put up the do not disturb sign, they still walked in telling me they had to fix something in the room which I never asked for. The room is not a hotel quality at all.

This hotel is for long stay holed and families or couples because this has big refrigerator and small kitchen. Their offer looked very affordable, but they requested me to pay $86 dollars as cleaning and other fees. It didn't appear anywhere and no mentioned about $90 payment in addition to $90 one night room charge. If I have to pay $180, I would select another one. The 2nd floor bar is very noisy and you need ear plugs if you don't like it. 1万円を切る破格の価格と思えば、同額くらいの追加料金を請求されます。長期には向くと思いますが、追加料金は事前に要確認です。それを払うなら他の通常ホテルでよいことがあります。2Fのバーがうるさいので、耳栓が必要な人はいるでしょう。

Close to the beach and close to shopping centres. Lovely hotel with great and friendly staff. Roxy was very friendly and helpful when I was checking in and also when my cable box all of a sudden stopped working. Not only was she very patient with me but she was able to move me into a different room with a working cable box. Great place!

We stayed in a room with kitchenette. It had everything we needed for preparing basic meals. This hotel is so handy to everything with a bus stop near by. New machines in laundry. Staff very friendly and willing to help with local knowledge. Excellent free wifi. Our room was same floor as the bar but in an outside section at back of building, so noise was not an issue. Only negative would be, the toilet was blocked and when we informed reception, we were handed a plunger to fix it ourselves. For the price and star rating, this hotel is value for money. I would stay again.

Located across from zoo and just a half Block from Waikiki beach it is the perfect place to stay. Walking distance to everything including my favorite grass beach. Great value for the dollar. No restaurant or room service but there is a small bar.

We arrived early and dropped off our bags and after using the really dirty lobby toilets we were worried about where we had booked. On checking in we were asked to pay more resort fee than our booking showed but they agreed to change this once we showed them the email from Qantas.The room was OK but very dated, sold as ocean view you can see the park and zoo over the road and some ocean at the far right, still very nice views. The room had half the cupboards locked as owners storage and its not services, no towels changed, no beds made and you have to ask at reception for more toilet rolls. There was a small air conditioner at floor level that did not cool the room well and blew right onto the bed. It leaked water on the balcony that had fake grass, this ended up being soaked and it blasted out hot air making sitting out there uncomfortable. The lady at reception in the afternoons was wonderful, she was very helpful making Taxi bookings etc and I cant fault her service. The place is half residential with owners living there with dogs etc, its not a hotel its a blend of residential and privately owned rooms that are rented when available.

Not your typical hotel, but the location is one of its best features. Our room was very nice, small kitchenette, very modern, clean and a small balcony that had a great view of diamond head and the ocean! The staff was very nice, especially Roxy at the front desk, so helpful and friendly, thanks for your aloha spirit!

This is a wonderful hotel with very kind helpful staff. The view from sun deck is spectacular. You can see the surfers in the ocean, the magnificent diamond head and the beautiful flamingoes in the zooThere's easy access to many restaurants and Starbucks is just a few steps away It's the perfect location The rooms are very quiet, clean and comfortable This is my favorite place to stay while I'm Waikiki Roxy at the front desk is always friendly and very conscientious I'm looking forward to coming back next year !Thank you so much Roxy for all you do !Kavie

Paid $180 online which wasn't the best deal but still a bit better than the more familiar names in town. Nice staff at front desk who will hold your bags after check-out which was nice. However, was shocked to be billed $52 upon check-in for room cleaning services as if that is not included in a regular hotel booking. Combining the two prices, we could have just stayed in a Sheraton or Regency. Lesson learned.Stay away - better options for the price.

The Waikiki Grand is a fantastic hotel, the staff is wonderful, Foxy Roxy makes your day, ice cold lemon water served in the lobby. The hotel was clean and well maintained. Great snorkeling is just across the road. Amazing views from the 10th floor and seating for your morning coffee. Secure room to put your luggage in if you have a late flight. Bus stop almost outside your door.Just make sure you get the right unit and not Hawaii Dive-0(506) Tried AirBnb, there were no pics of the kitchen, we now know why, Mini bar fridge WITHOUT freezer, bar sink, no plate in microwave, one burner hotplate with broken knob. Mini-microwave and mini coffee maker. 1 plate, and a childs disc with an owl on it to eat off of. For goodness sake, 4pce dinnerware $20 at Walmart. No teaspoons, only 3 towels, mismatched sheet and cover, 1 beach towel. NO beach amenities so be prepared to buy any mats, chair etc. Fold down futon nightmare to sleep on, size of a twin bed, 1"mattress with a metal rod down the middle. Sliding door doesn't close or lock, but has a handy PVC pipe to keep you safe. Other reviewer said only one person, totally agree, if you are used to 3rd world conditions. We called it the closet. Constant droning noise even when AC turned off from buildings AC unit 24/7, bring earplugs. View is of alley full of garbage, a tree and other higher buildings. Had to figure Wifi code out because the sheet left with info was wrong. Shower unit a nightmare, dirty hair trap, dirty bathroom fan, bathroom floor washed with the door open because a dirt trail left when you close the door. Only good point is the location of the building not the unit. In the words of Taylor Swift we are NEVER, NEVER getting back together. Renter needs to spend a couple hundred $$ and make it at least acceptable.

Not a typical hotel - it's more of a condo complex where many units are available as hotel rooms. We had a City View with Kitchenette. Room was very clean and modern. Only problem was that the refrigerator was not as cold as i like, but that was a minor issue. We may be a bit biased because we selected the hotel based on the fact that there is a gay bar on the second floor of the complex. (I actually found the hotel when searching for bars.) Our room was on 3rd floor, so we were steps away from nightlife whenever we wanted.The staff is wonderful - especially Roxy at the front desk. She's so helpful - can answer any question about her town - and, she's a sweetheart. Location is amazing - on the edge of Waikiki, so there aren't the hordes of shoppers clogging the sidewalks. The beach is right there. The zoo is across the street, so you're not surrounded by buildings - and the views from the 10th floor deck (ocean and Diamond Head) are amazing. There is a great burger place (Teddy's Bigger Burger) on the first floor that also serves huge breakfasts. I didn't read any reviews before visiting, but read many during some down time while visiting. I don't understand the ones who complained. I mean - one person complained about animal noises coming from the zoo. Well - there is something called Google Maps - and it clearly shows the zoo across the street. Why complain about some exotic bird songs. It's like buying a home near an airport and complaining about jet noise. Another complained about power use being regulated. That is preposterous. That person probably ran the microwave and hairdryer at the same time and tripped a circuit breaker.It is the best value in Waikiki and I highly recommend it. It's not beachfront, but the beach is a half-block away.Tips - book early; and if you plan to rent a car, definitely book early so you can get on the list for parking (which you will have to pay for.)

clean unit.The beddings were all clean as well. Theres a laundry room downstairs in the basement (p1) and it was also clean! Im all about cleanliness and customer service and this hotel went beyond! the staff are all very friendly. very close to the beach and plus a starbucks for anyone needing that caffeine fix early in the morning. theres a lot of shops and restaurants nearby so its a great location.

It's not the newest hotel but the location is fantastic and the staff make this place awesome. In particular Roxy at the front desk went out of her way to make sure everything went smoothly for me. Friendly service all around.

This is NOT a new, luxurious Waikiki property. That said, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay...."Foxy Roxy" is a great asset at the front desk, with a WINNING attitude and smile. Hula's Bar and Lei Stand on the second floor is a great watering hole, but be advised it's a gay bar, if that matters to you....view from the panoramic top floor deck are SPECTACULAR, and if you're lucky, you'll hear the elephants trumpeting in the Zoo right across the street.

The staff at this hotel were very helpful, we were disappointed with the room. The best part about this hotel is the view from the sun deck over the beach and the zoo.The first morning we could not work out how to operate the shower, you had to pull down the bath spout discharge. I have used a lot of shower/baths and have never had to pull down on the spout discharge to get the shower to work. The staff were happy to show us how to use the shower. The TV did not work, the staff tried to fix it, but could not. They suggested we ring Hawaii telecom to get advice on how to fix the TV. Not having a phone, we lived without the TV.We also had to pay an extra US$116 as a room cleaning fee on checkin, which I think is excess considering the room was not serviced daily and we only stayed three night.
