We stayed here for the majority of our honeymoon, friendly staff for the most part and a clean and tidy room, however, at three am at three minute intervals three nights in a row the smoke detected siren went off in everyone's room, no one seemed to know why, we didn't know weather to evacuate or stay put, I went to the lobby with half the other guests and were told to stop asking questions because the night security did not know what was happening.All and all though a great location and so close to everything required ie the beach, the shops, the food and the entertainment.Also if you ask nicely the wonderful lady at the front counter will let you borrow water toys, lilo's and body boards. Note: book tours and activities with the guys with push trolleys and flyers on the Main Street, they are cheaper and have more options then the concierge.

The location was the only redeeming quality to our stay. Quick walk to the beach. The staff often had attitude and clearly did not want to be there. The room had so many things wrong with it I don't even know when to start. The door itself didn't close and lock properly in place, which resulted in the door jiggling when touched. On the back of the door was a hook, which had a hinge hanging from it! I don't know, maybe put that to use? The room was very small, had a mini fridge with rust around edges. No sink, so don't expect much kitchen wise. It didn't have a lock box! I'm glad I had a lock on my luggage to secure my valuables. There was dust on countertops and bathroom. I wouldn't even bother trying to go to the pool. In order to get to it, you need to walk through the adjoining restaurant. Once you get there it is small and shady. I wouldn't bother paying for a room at this place. Save you money and go spend it somewhere else.

What a shock and disappointment we had when checking into our room....looked more like student self-catering accommodation from the 1970's!! We expected a proper hotel but the room was dated, old wooden cupboard doors padlocked with owner's possessions inside, a broken bedside lamp fixed with sellotape, a dated bathroom suite, faded duvet cover, bulbs out in main light, a TV that didn't work and an old sunken futon. This is no hotel. Horrendous fire alarm went off two nights in a row with no explanation and no apology. The saving grace for this place is the location. Coach tours don't even pick up from here, you have to pick up at neighbouring hotels. I suppose it was clean though! I was embarrassed to be staying here. One to forget.

This hotel was located 100 yards from the beach. Units are Individually owned. Our specific unit was clean and had everything we needed. It was perfect for a budget trip. I usually stay to the Hilton and I would say that I am happy with this choice. Value is definitely in the view and location! I would stay here again, but it wouldn't be my first choice.

We stayed here at the end of travelling across the USA. Our room was a good size, basic and clean. We had a little kitchenette which was handy, bathroom was small but clean and decent size bath (aslong as a room is clean doesnt matter to me if a little outdate!). To me the hotel was in a great spot! A 2 minute walk and you were at the amazing waikiki beach, with the zoo opposite and views of Diamond Head. Staff were very helpful and provided beach towels and boogy boards for the beach :)There is a fast food restaurant attached to the hotel & the food is lovely and you get a lot. Not expensive and friendly staff. There is also a small convenience store short walk which has everything in. There is a club/bar in the hotel which is gay friendly (i feel some reviews on here view this negatively). To me it was great, served lovely food, live music and cheap drinks. Bar staff friendly too! We would definately stay here again!

My husband and I spent 10 days in Hawaii and we booked a room at the Castle Waikiki Grand Hotel for our first 5 days which were spent in Waikiki. The room was clean, but TINY! From my understanding, that's the trend in Waikiki. (Think NYC living) The location was great, everything was within walking distance. Restaurants, bars, and stores are all located on a main strip. It reminded me of a laid back, beach bum version of "Miami's South Beach." The beach is literally right across the street from the hotel. The Honolulu Zoo is also across the street as well as a large public park. In the event you get tired of walking or don't have a car, an Uber ride up the main strip is only around $10.00. If you do rent a car, beware! parking is minimal and expensive! The hotel has a bar on the second floor, but it is a Gay bar so we opted to take a walk down the strip to visit other bars. There is a pool, but it is also tiny. There were literally only 4 beach/lounge chairs set up near the pool. There is also a "burger joint" and nail salon on the main floor. Overall, the location can't be beat, but don't expect to fit more than two people comfortably in these rooms.

Poorly maintained room, and incredibly small. Really, really small. The loud AC unit is right next to the bed and will freeze the person out who is on that side. The sink was clogged and some plumbing parts had been left out on the sink when we checked in. The shower head leaks and sprays everywhere. The door lock is loose too. Great location, fairly nice building overall, but terrible room.Yes, the location is excellent for the price, so its still a pretty good deal.

Roxy was an is the most friendly amazing hotel receptionist i have ever deal with. ..she went out of her way to be so so accommodating an helped me sort out an issue I had going on..her service was amazing and so helpful in evryway possible...I wil never forget her genuine kindness and am sure anyone dealing with Roxy wil have the same experience. Thankyou again Roxy.. M Bryant NZ

This is an apartment hotel, and the units are individually owned. ( so I am lead to believe) Our apartment was smaller than almost every other hotel room I have ever stayed in. It was really tired and honestly, rather grotty and poorly maintained. The dust on top of the TV was so thick!!!The aircon is one of those old window ones and it failed to cool our room and was noisy. The TV kept losing reception. Upon arrival we were asked to pay a cleaning fee as well!!!!! As I had booked through a third party, I had the document stating total price to pay. Check in was not smooth either, but perhaps that was an issue with the 3rd party booking site. On the upside, it is very conveniently located and provides a cheaper option for accommodation.

We found Roxy at the front desk to be incredibly friendly and helpful. It was a great room and a wonderful stay. Close to everything down that end. Hulas bar downstairs was fantastic if you like dancing and drinking happy hour drinks. Highly recommended!! We had a wonderful stay.

Lobby area on arrival looked promising. Room allocated was tiny and beside the large airconditioning units that serviced the whole hotel. Noise levels so high (even tried earplugs) sleep impossible. In fairness, on explaining this the following day we were moved to a larger and nicer room with very little fuss. First morning waiting in lobby for rest of our party approached by guest who was stoned/mentally ill? In fairness, receptionist tried to divert her away from us for remainder of our wait. Had not realised "gay friendly" would mean pick up area and regular trafficking from the front accessway. Many guests were complaining about many issues at the desk whenever we went there. Rooms are tired and grotty, stained and dirty carpets. Sheets with holes in, in our first room allocation. Location is superb - very close to beach and if you have the right room you overlook Zoo and Diamond Head and the ocean. If your room doesn't overlook it you can see that view from the rooftop terrace. This did not feel like a hotel as the rooms were only serviced every three days.

Stayed in Room 904. The room was tiny and stifling hot as the air conditioning was totally ineffective but very loud - it probably hadn't been serviced - and we couldn't leave the balcony door open as there wasn't a screen door although the instructions in the room required the screen to be closed to keep out insects! The carpet was threadbare, heavily stained and dirty. The mattress on the bed was old and sagged, the bed itself swayed disconcertingly whenever we got in or out. There was dirt built up along the floor and walls in the entrance. The deadbolt on the door did not work. The bathroom was not big enough to have a proper door but had a sliding door that only closed a third of the way. The bathroom walls had splatter around the toilet and the floor tiles were poorly laid with dirt filled gaps at the walls and by the bath. The shower/bath grout was stained, possibly mildew. There was not any soap, only one bath towel (for two guests) and the room was only "cleaned" every third day (i.e. the day we left). We had to,pay the full amount on check-in, presumably to stop guests from leaving early to find decent accommodation, which we would have done if we'd been able to. Yes, the Grand has a great location across from the beach and zoo, and yes it is a budget hotel BUT there are minimum acceptable standards that this hotel fails on multiple counts. We have stayed in challenging accommodation in Africa, South America, the Philippines and Eastern Europe but this hotel ranks as one of the worst. Find space in your budget, however tight, to stay elsewhere.

We selected this hotel based on Kamaaina rate. Was a little worried when I read reviews. Got to the hotel and Roxy was there to check us in. Shared my concerns and she said we would be ok with the room we had. It was decent, small, but it had a kitchenette so very helpful to store snacks and drinks. Downside to the room was no water pressure in shower, a/c very loud and above bed, tried to open window but super loud traffic and city noise. Parking was $17 and highly encourage calling ahead to reserve a spot. It is right across the zoo, close to beach, Starbucks, ABC store, and Teddy's Bigger Burgers.

Roxy, the nice front desk personnel, did all she can do to allow me to extend my stay for one more night although the hotel was fully booked on the date of my stay. I ended up with an upgraded room at the same price!

I have to say I was blown away by this hotel and will gladly return in the future. All we wanted was a cheap hotel close to the beach - the Waikiki Grand delivered on that and more. We got a good deal for booking on Black Friday, and Waikiki Beach is about a 2 minute walk from the front steps of the hotel. Already we were pleased. But then the hotel offered so much more. Our room was excellent, despite it being one of the economy rooms. It included a full size fridge, microwave, etc. It was clean and while the décor was a little kitschy, it had lots of space. There were laundry facilities in the building. There was very reasonably priced parking. There is an incredibly fun gay bar on the second floor of the building with daily drink specials. There was complimentary water gear for the beach. But what made this place all that more special was the customer service. The woman who worked at the front desk was so genuinely warm and friendly we immediately felt at home. Again, we loved our visit and I would return in a heartbeat. Thanks so much for the fantastic stay!

was very comfortable and the view OMG one direction of balcony was diamond head and the other the beach was AMAZINGwe walked everywhere, even down to cheesecake factory and friday night free fireworks

Stayed here fro the 26th-July 4th. This hotel is close to so much shopping and restaurants. You can't go wrong with location! The rooms are small, so be prepared. During checkout they tried to charge us a $90 fee for cleaning! We refused the maid service the one time she did come by. The hotel said it was a new fee they are now charging. The staff was really nice, but whatever you need make sure you have before the regular ladies leave, the security guards are clueless to most issues!

Front desk Lady named Roxy was awesome and took care of me. This is the 1st time staying here and felt as though we've known each other for many years although we only met tonight. She treats everyone the same tourist and locals alike because I witnessed it for myself upon check in tonight. Once again Kudos to Roxy you are the front line and the 1st contact people will see or talk to the only one that can make or break someone's visit here. Good job!

We only stayed here for 2 nights at the beginning of our trip before heading off to Maui. We wanted something close to Waikiki with easy access to the shops/restaurants. The location was great! It was a 15 second walk to the beach and the room was tiny but very clean. The only issue is we called ahead of time to reserve parking and were told you will receive parking when you check in. Well, we checked in and were told we were supposed to reserve parking ahead of time and there were no spots left! So we had to scramble to find parking on the streets or at the zoo. Def a hassle you do not want while on vacation. Poor communication on the hotel's part!

The first room given to me was average, and was later upgraded when I extended my stay. The hotel is a bit old, but the roof deck has a perfect view of the Diamond Head State Monument. It is easy for a solo traveler to walk from the hotel to Diamond Head and back.

This is a privately owned property available for rent on VRBO or HomeAway. This large studio condo has been refurbished and renovated. It came on the market only in January of 2016. This space is owner operated by Brenda who was a delight to work with. Our stay was two weeks long and we enjoyed every minuet of it!The condo itself is well appointed providing absolutely everything you could need and more.It's new and therefore pristinely clean and all the renovation work is top notch. Well located, just a minuet or two from the beach, it has great access to all that is Waikiki but also you are at the far end of the strip and facing the Zoo and Queen Kapiolani Park so you are out of the crazy that can also be Waikiki. We travel the world and also come back to Hawaii, where my husband and I met, very frequently. We have often rented apartments, houses and condos where ever we travel and always on Oahu. I can safely say that this property is as advertised and more. The owner is easy to deal with and helpful and the value is above average. Best suited to two adults or two adults and one child. Perfectly clean and absolutely pest free! The kitchen is quite " cook-unable" and the bathroom and shower are new and large enough to be quite comfortable. Brenda says new curtains are on order and with fairly good air-con, the place is complete and almost Lux compared to what is available in Waikiki and especially in the rest of this building/hotel for the most part. The hotel in which the condo is available is part hotel, part residential and part vacation rental. It is clean, in good repair, and safe. Parking is available from the front desk at a fee per day. It is reasonable and again...safe.I trust Brenda will keep up the condo well and if she does, I can't recommend her condo more highly.We will be back and will happily make 821 Waikiki Grand our home base in Waikiki over and over again. It was a great find!

Don't expect more than an average hotel room. The room is dated and in need of renovations. But the location is perfect. Steps from Waikiki beach, across the street from the Honolulu Zoo, walking distance to the Aquarium and Waikiki shops, Kapahulu eating area and Waikiki activities. We only need a place to sleep and it was good enough. Park at the zoo for only $1 an hour and street parking is free 7 pm to 7 am. Would stay here again.

I'm a local resident born and raised, lived in SF Bay Area for 15yrs before moving back. I'm writing this to thank Roxy, one of the most friendliest concierge persons I know. A couple of days ago, I happen to be bodyboarding at Consessions break there in Waikiki. Long story short my car keys got washed away to the sea :)Not having any acces to my car, phone, money, I happen to walk into the Castle Waikiki Grand Hotel. Looking for help to call my insurance company. Roxy was soo gracious to allow me to borrow the front desk phone to make the toll free call. She asked me if all was ok, and even gave me her pen as I contacted my insurance company. She has the true spirit of Aloha, and if that is the front desk experience, then I know for sure the rest of my stay in the future will be Grand! Every once in a while it is good to stay and relax in Waikiki, and next time I'm definetly going to book my stay with Roxy at Castle Waikiki Grand Hotel!!Much Mahalo and love and Aloha for all your help when I was in need! I really appreciate it and will always remember it and also pass it along to others!!Thanks are Roxy and see you all soon!

It was what we expected. room had full size refrigerator with microwave, coffee maker, stove top with all utensils, dinnerware and cookware, including toaster. room is cleaned every 3 days, these are condos, not hotel rooms. our lanai on fifth floor overlooked Honolulu zoo and park with great views of Diamond Head and ocean view as it is a block from the beach and pier. It is at the east end of Waikiki. Hula's bar and lei stand is on the second floor. Teddy's Bigger Burgers is on the first floor(lobby). Breakfast is not included, but Teddy's serves breakfast. Many restaurants are within 2-3 bocks.

We booked this through airbnb and host was perfect. The property is next to the Honolulu Zoo and literally 2 min away from Waikiki Beach. There's a small swimming pool, a Hula Bar on the 2nd floor and Teddy's bigger burgers on ground floor. Also an ABC store next to the hotel which is very convenient. The unit was beautiful and clean - Bed was very comfortable; good room size also. If we ever go back to O'ahu, we would stay at the Waikiki Grand again.

Had a great weekend at your hotel we received excellent service from Roxy, she was very attentive, nice and always smiling. We were tourist for the whole weekend, visiting with friends/family that came from the mainland, going to the beach, eating at different restaurants, dancing, or just hanging around the pool drinking and talking was all good. Will definitely be back again.

This has to be the best value hotel in Waikiki. It is situated about 100 metres from the beach and has everything nearby; the beach, mini mart, restaurants, bars, Starbucks and opposite the zoo.The kitchenette was well equipped with a microwave, toaster, coffee maker, fridge etc. The bedding was excellent, quality every bit as good as the high end hotels, the bathroom was clean but old style.The sun deck on the 10th floor is a must at sunset with a sensational view of the beach and Diamond Head.Room are only routinely service every 3rd day.

Roxy at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. Location is excellent. Safe property. Definitely a value hotel and it was clean. Room pictures on internet did not match up to lesser quality room we were in. Bed was not very comfortable. Hotel policy on towels is a little stingy. This hotel's "green" policy means they only have Maid Service every three days. For me, part of the luxury of staying in a hotel is having leaving unmade room in the morning and coming back to a beautifully made room. If I wanted a "lived in" room, I'd stay home ( i live on another HI island) or stay in a condo.

Conveniently located upstairs from Hula's Bar & Grill, our room was quite large for a studio and had a full equipped kitchen with a nice large marble shower. The panoramic view of Diamond Head and the ocean from the 10th floor is unmatched. All the people at the front desk were very friendly, especially Roxy! It is reasonably priced for the area. I would definitely stay here again.

Loved the condo which was well equipped and close to beach, restaurants, shopping, etc. A little bit of street noise but that didn't bother us as the location made up for it. Honolulu Zoo was across the street as well as a beautiful park.

The Waikiki Grand was affordable and a very good location for us. It is across from the zoo, one block from Kapiolani Park and a short block from the beach.The hotel is not a high end hotel, but was very clean and comfortable.The front desk person, Roxy, couldn't have been nicer, friendlier or more helpful.She just made us feel so welcome. This was the highlight of this hotel.

The property is part hotel, part condos, and the hotel rooms could use a little "refreshing" (for example, rust stains on bathroom fixtures, etc. - a consequence of the sea air!). That having been said, the price is excellent, the location is perfect (steps away from the strip & Waikiki Beach), handy to the water, restaurants, the Honolulu Zoo (right across the street), yet far enough from the frenetic strip to be peaceful.If you're looking for a high-end, luxury place that is its own destination, look elsewhere. On the other hand, if you're looking for a very reasonably-priced, handy place to sleep & stow your stuff between outings (I can't imagine going to Waikiki for any other reason, but I suppose some might...), the Castle Waikiki can't be beat. The staff are uniformly friendly and helpful (during a brief rainstorm, the young man at the front desk offered to get us his umbrella from his car for us to use!), and they have a sense of humor, as well! One day, they were working on the plumbing, and there were posters up advising the water would be off for an hour the next morning. No biggie, as we were out sightseeing anyway. The NEXT day, there were posters up advising not to use the toilets for the weekend due to plumbing issues! We were steamed, and charged down to the front desk. The lady there was laughing, and pointed out the fine print at the bottom of the posters...sure enough, we'd forgotten it was....April 1st, April Fool's day. Yup, we got pranked, big time! It was hilarious, and we're still telling friends about it.All in all, it's a great value, in a great location. Don't expect the Hilton, go for the fun, and you'll enjoy every minute of it.

It's an older building but a super location in Waikiki! Out the door and you have the beach, zoo and park a minutes' walk. Teddy's Burgers (I love their salads) in the lobby and one of the best views of Diamond Head on the 11th floor.Big Mahalos/thank you to Brian, and especially Roxy, who both work very hard to keep the property humming along. Roxy really brings the Aloha with a huge smile and helped me with directions, change for the laundry, sightseeing tips and even arranged my shuttle to the airport.Nothing too fancy at the Grand but I really felt at home there!

My name is Liz and My friend, Rocio and I stayed 7 days and 6 nights at this hotel for a Salsa Congress we were attending, and never have I met a friendlier staff, than Brad and Roxy! I am so grateful that we stayed at this hotel because my friend left her passport, and green card in a drawer at the hotel. BRAD, was so helpful when we called from the airport. He put me on hold, and went to our room to check the drawer, and immediately told me he had found it, and was sending it to me by mail! I got it all complete, including a pair of sandals we had forgotten within the week!! Roxy was always so sweet and helpful, just like Brad! They both made it a pleasure to stay at their hotel! The location was fantastic! We were within walking distance to everything!! We didn't have to spend any money on Uber or rent a car to get to all the Hotels! And a big plus, the Beach was half a block across the street!! Rooms are extremely small, and we didn't get a nice view, but then again, we were not there to hang out in the room, just to sleep and shower! The room was very clean, but they don't do daily housekeeping. Only every 3 days, but you can get fresh towels everyday from Brad or Roxy! They even gave us Beach towels for free! The room had a working refrigerator, microwave, coffee pot, Ironing board and iron, dishes, utensils, glasses, can openers, etc. We were able to save a lot of money on eating out! It was very quiet and we were able to get a good nights rest every night!And once there, we discovered it is pet friendly!! We had first booked at the Hilton hotel but we cancelled when we discovered that we could stay here for $1000 less for the same amount of time!! It wasn't the Hilton, but we were not on our Honeymoon and hardly spent any time in the room!! Again I want to Thank Brad for helping us and being so computer savvy and helping me print out my boarding passes on their computer and printer, when I couldn't figure it out!Will definitely come back and stay at this hotel!

This is a clean, comfortable and quant hotel in Waikiki, with the main draw card being the view and location. It's a 2 minute walk to the beach, Honolulu Zoo and boasts incredible ocean and mountain views. The staff are friendly and there are plenty of places to eat and shop nearby. We thought it was perfect and good value for money.

Stayed 5 nights at Castle's Waikiki Grand Hotel and loved it, the views were spectacular. Great staff, Roxy was always on the front desk friendly and ready to help. The room size was fine as we were out so much all we went to the room for was sleep. There was a microwave, stovetop and utensils if you wish to make food in the room. The wifi was excellent and a great choice of channels on the TV. Well worth the price and would stay here again.

We booked our room through AirBNB and we were a bit disappointed with the room size but it was clean and who comes to Hawaii to stay in their room anyway? The location was perfect. Close walking distance to everything, with beautiful Waikiki Beach a block away. The best thing about this place is the 10th floor terrace. A spectacular view of Diamond Head, the zoo, and the beach. Loved it and would stay here again.

Spent three nights at Castle's Waikiki Grand Hotel. Spectacular view from the sun deck on the 10th floor! Our studio was spacious with a full kitchen. The room and bed were comfortable and homey. The location is perfect, across the street from the Honolulu Zoo. Away from the overcrowded feeling of Waikiki but still just seconds from the beach. Will definitely stay there again.

Room was on the top floor, with the absolute best view ever. Everything was perfect. At the front desk, Roxy was always there to assist you, whatever your needs. Although this is not a five star hotel, you can not find a more affordable, comfortable, and convenient place to stay. I have booked more expensive rooms, but the location alone makes this more desirable. I will definitely be back

I had a major problem with my reservation from Bookit.com. I fully paid for my 5 night stay but Bookit.com canceled my reservation so when I arrived, I didn't have a room! Luckily, Roxy at the Front Desk realized that the error was on Bookit.com and not mine. She was very helpful in getting me a room and sorting out the mess with Bookit.com. Thank you Roxy for your help. And be aware of Bookit.com.

Was highly disappointed with our room, it was small and really outdated. I will say that the view is what we paid for, we had a view of both diamond head mountain and the ocean/beach. The staff was friendly. We were sold a parking spot, after being gone all day we came back and someone was in our spot the front desk guy came out and told us to park in another spot and assured us several times it would be okay, when we came out in the morning we had a warning; tow away sticker put on or rental car! Totally annoying.

We booked more than six months ahead, but they had no room when we arrived. A RUDE front desk clerk sent us to another Castle property - the cab she put us in dropped us off at the wrong hotel and we had to find and walk to the property on our own, dragging our suitcases down the sidewalk. Property was run down, with only one working elevator for 168 rooms on 15 floors. We'll NEVER stay with Castle again!

Great area of town with access to everything we needed, The hotel was clean, pet friendly and well landscaped. Late night check in was difficult. A night desk clerk is needed. Small kitchen nook and bathroom crevice, but no less than was needed for two people.

Keep in mind when booking that this is a 2-star hotel. You won't get daily maid service (it's every 3 days). We booked through the hotel's website and it fit perfectly in our budget. We didn't expect the frills of a 3- or 4-star hotel but our room was clean and comfortable. The drains worked. The A/C worked. We had a microwave and mini-fridge too. We loved the location--at the end of the main strip but super close to the beach and bus stops. We're sad to go home. Thanks for a wonderful stay!

the room we had was small and the drain in the shower was plugged. we went to ask about an upgrade that I was willing to purchase, but the manager was very helpful and put us in a larger room for no extra cost. Don't expect daily service but anything you need is available from the front desk. This hotel is only a few steps to the beach and trolley stops. There is a nice top floor deck that is open to the guests that overlooks the zoo, diamond head and the ocean. The sunrise over diamond head is fantastic and the ocean sunset is beautiful from the deck.

I stayed at Waikiki Grand from 12/6/15-12/15/15 in room #715. I had booked the room through vacation rent by owner (VRBO). Upon arrival, the unit appeared clean & had everything I needed...kitchenette with all the cooking appliances, tv/cable, wifi, clean towels/bed linens & nice bathroom. During my stay, I wokeup with several bug bites. On 12/7/15, I found 2 bed bugs, 1 on the wall next to the tv & 1 on the wall behind my bedframe. I placed both bed bugs in a plastic bag & contacted management. They claimed the bed bugs most likely were lying dormant in the room. They exterminated the room for 4 hrs., a couple days later, I found 2 more bed bugs & contacted management again but they couldn't come exterminate again until a day later. We were then told that the bed bugs were most likely coming from another room & stated that they had issues on that floor with people not cleaning their apts. We were never offered a new room, we should have never had to stay in a room that needed to be exterminated more than twice & risked getting bed bugs in our luggage, etc. It is digusting. Though, manager terry attempted to make the situation right by exterminating the unit, I wouldn't stay there again. We should have atleast got a new room or discount for the inconvenience. The location is great! Walking distance to everything, but not worth the bed bugs. Stay elsewhere!

Great location - close to everything. I stayed on the 10th floor in an apartment. Great apartment - nice and roomy with a good kitchen. King bed and couch. Right across the road from the beach. Staff were very helpful.

We booked here as a "budget" hotel. And it certainly was, the only place for "high speed wifi" was the lobby, not the rooms as specified, the room was small and very dark. The lamp had a busted light, and only the light over the kitchenette worked. The night security was very rude, as my fiancé went up to our room (at 11:30pm) I waited at the front to finish my cigarette, being a foreign girl in Hawaii and that the hotel is in a area of Waikiki with lots of homeless people and people who are clearly effected by drugs/ alcohol I thought I would move into the line of sight of the security guard. He prompty came to the top of the stairs and told me that if he has to speak to me about smoking at the front of the hotel again he will write me up a citation! I was shocked at his rudeness even when I tried explaining I just wanted to be in his line of sight! The ONLY good thing about the hotel was Roxy on the front desk, she was wonderful and always smiling, giving us good advice, and making sure we were okay! Over all, if your looking for a budget hotel keep searching, bypass this hotel, pay the extra $30 a night and stay some where better.

I was very pleased with my experience. This hotel has a lot going on. Part of the building houses residences. On the ground floor there is Teddy's Bigger Burgers. I had mixed emotions on staying there the night before Halloween, but when I saw a rate for $99 several weeks in advance went ahead and locked it in. My room on the 8th floor was very nice, clean and cozy. I was very impressed with the balcony city view, the balcony furniture, the big counter in the main area inside, having a bar stool for that counter, and the huge big screen on the wall. The check out time was noon and they let me keep it to 1pm. Upon checking in, it was very convenient to order a burger from Teddy's, and on the following morning to phone in an order for breakfast. Shortly after getting my room I went to the beach to swim, it was a quick and easy walk to a very nice Waikiki beach. Across the street is the zoo and Kapiolani Park, and great views to Diamond Head so its a nice break from all the concrete.

This is not a 5 start hotel but you get a good accommodation,clean rooms, The staff were all very friendly specially Roxy. On the bright side it was only a stone throw away from the beach, zoo and shopping promenade.

This hotel suited our needs perfectly. I pre-booked a parking spot in the limited space car park underground. The location was perfect being so close to the beach. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again.

Prime loxatio location but it had a feel like it was grandma's unit from the 80s.Very cramped and not much consideration for "privacy" in the bathroom with its weird foldable doors. The light coming through from the walkway outside of our room meant that I slept horribly. For some reason the designer thought it would be good to place a wall full of windows inside the bedside cupboard. I think this was just the configuration of our room. Perhaps a room facing the zoo would be better.The amenities were very used and tired, but on the bright side it was only a stone throw away from the beach, zoo and shopping promenade.The staff were all very friendly!

We booked this through Homeaway as a rental studio property p665659vb. I would recommend it. Here is the review we posted on HomeAwayThis is a great studio with a convenient location at the southern end of Waikiki. It was clean and furnished very nicely and had all the equipment we needed for a few days stay; we felt very comfortable here. It is an apartment in the Waikiki Grand Hotel building, which has a lively bar on the 2nd floor. The bar caters for a gay clientele, but is friendly and welcoming to all. We enjoyed: The furnishings and fittings in the studioGood A/CGood wifiThe bar in the hotel propertyProximity to beach, zoo and parkConvenient distance to Diamond Head crater where there is good hiking and fantastic views from the rimConvenient walk to downtown Waikiki in the evenings to sample the nightlifeRooftop patio area with great views of Diamond Head, Beach and oceanConvenient and reliable bus service from nearby for visiting Pearl HarbourLocal ABC food store, open with essential items when we arrived lateFriendly and helpful reception staffDownsidesThere were not many downsides to this property as it was very well presented, but it would have been nice to have had a better view from the window.Some people might prefer to be closer to town if you want to walk less than 15min.No outside space except communal patio on top floor .. The swimming pool is small and the access is via the burger restaurant on the ground floor.

Although it is close to the beach, it is not in the center of it all in Waikiki. The street is difficult to get to and parking is paid.24 hr reception, but at night it`s the security guard, so sometimes you'll have to wait. The morning receptionist was rude to us - so unlike Hawaii!Room is ok, small beds (we asked a room for 3 women but the room had 2 small double beds, got a little crowded).Parking is aprund USD 25 per day.You can find better deals elsewhere.

This hotel is a great place to stay. We have rented here many times before.The workers (Rob, Roxane) are very friendly.The cleaning staff (Mila) takes good care of the rooms.This hotel is directly across from the Zoo.

Front desk is very friendly but this is not really a conventional hotel rather a series of owner owned units in a rental pool. because of this there is not any consistency between apartments and items provided in the kitchen may be quite basic and limited. rooms also are quite small and only get serviced every 3 days. Daily service costs an extra $25 per day.

This hotel has great location, right by Waikiki beach and Honolulu Zoo, close to Diamond Head. Close to shops, restaurants, bars. The hotel rooms were renovated, nice, furnished with full kitchen, my balcony was overlooking city and hotel pool. Free WiFi. Housekeeping every 3 days. Great view of Diamond Head and Waikiki beach from the roof deck. Beautiful sunsets.

We stayed at a residence room in this hotel via Airbnb. It's a bit old, but the service is great. Roxy in particular at the front desk proved a huge asset to helping us manage our stay and get what we needed. There were also laundry facilities, and it was easy to book parking as-needed. We'd readily stay again. The only issue we really had was wifi, which wasn't great in our room: the hotel has multiple connections with the same password, but the strongest connection appeared to require a different one. When we brought it up with the front desk, some weird chap (not Roxy!) blamed it on our Apple products...?!!

The hotel is old and the rooms weird. I had a kitchenette two steps away from my bed. It was a little dirty upon arrival (bare feet showed lots of dirt and hairs all over the bathroom). There was a single tiny air conditioning machine that really didn't cool the room, especially during the hottest hours. The ventilator, for some reason, was non-functioning. The room was big enough for 2 people, had a view to the back and covered the windows behind the bed with several curtains that really didn't keep the light out. I kept on waking at night due to the amount of light. Cleaning was done every third day, that means that your amenities should last that long also. The room was very silent, I never heard from my "neighbors". Furniture is really old.Wifi, provided for free, was TERRIBLE. I could get at the same time 6 different modems of the hotel, none of which had a good connection (unpaired easily) and all presented extremely slow speeds.Staff was courteous throughout my stay. Beach towels and boogie boards are available without fuzz or charge.It is well located, in my opinion, in the best part of Waikiki, away from the skyscrapers and next to the zoo. You go out and you have a lovely park in front of you, the beaches aren't that crowded and several restaurants are nearby. If you need to park your car, the zoo is convenient and fairly priced ($1 USD per hour as of 2015).

I had a free night from hotels.com, so we stayed here two nights in the week before our wedding in Hawaii. Our families both live in Hawaii, so we didn't really explore the area around the hotel. I thought the hotel was quite nice for what we paid. It had a pretty big kitchen, though we didn't use it. I thought it was weird that there was no hand soap though. The glass coffee table and the couch looked nice enough, but the couch was a bit uncomfortable to sit on and I kept knocking my legs on the coffee table. The bed was fine. There was a roach in the bathroom, but it is Hawaii. A good option if you're looking for a budget hotel.

I needed a quick last minute getaway in December when everything in Hawaii is ridiculously overpriced. However, I came across Castle Waikiki for a great price and saw decent reviews for this hotel. For the price I paid it was a steal. It was more than enough space for one person including a massive living room and full size kitchen. My room even had a washer and dryer for the clothes I needed to wash after getting them all covered with sand and ocean water. My room was an elevator ride and a couple steps away from the beach. My room was clean and felt safe. I would definitely come here again if ever I were to travel to Honolulu in December since the prices are crazy everywhere else.

In terms of price-quality, it's a good deal with good location, near the beach, across a park, rooftop terrace, numbered lock so no need to carry a room key card and a kitchenette. Furnitures were bit worn with old curtain.

review_body: Very accommodation for our quick stay at Waikiki beach. Roxy was very informative about the area and she is very friendly. The room was very nice and clean. Location very close to beach and shopping. With kind regards Dave and Kasey Stoverink

We nearly didn't book this rental because of some of the reviews. Needless to say, our stresses were put aside as soon as we arrived! The location couldn't have been better and the hotel was far nicer than we were expecting for the price! Literally right on the beach, with shops of all kinds, moped rentals and lots of activities right there, including a farmers market over the weekend and the zoo. The pool wasn't the most luxurious setting, but the rooftop deck has incredible unblocked views of diamond head and the park. Starbucks is also next door along with a convenience store for basic needs, and a full grocery store about a mile walk. We did get a rental car, but there was honestly so much to do just right there, that we ended up not using it for most of our stay. In short, if you are looking for that classic Waikiki beach vacation without breaking the bank this is the perfect place to stay. We hope we can visit here again!

Our group had 2 separate reservations (in consecutive confirmation numbers) for our recent 2 night stay. Sadly, when we showed up at check-in, they were only expecting 1 room. No worries, because Roxie at the front desk was able to fix everything and gave the second room on the same floor. Best part, she was able to honor the same rates instead of a last minute walk-in rate and gave the missing reservation a bigger room at the end of the hallway (sofabed plus a regular queen sized bed).The condo-hotel parking garage below has limited spaces. Be sure to reserve the space for your rental car during check-in. There is a coin-operated laundry room on the basement as well. Very handy especially when you have lots of sand and salty clothing.This property is better than most properties on AirB*** because they all have a minimum standard of amenities that is consistent for the entire property. Housekeeping is available upon request or on every 3rd day of your stay. Compared to my previous stays, the property has now eliminated physical keys to the rooms. They are now using reprogrammable access code locks on the doors.OBTW, pool was closed for renovation in April 2015.

review_body: The hotel is at the end of Waikiki beach and is right next to Kapiolani Park, the Honolulu Zoo , Aquarium, Waikiki beach volleyball courts and the many eating spots of the Kapahulu area. The rooms are tight and the beds are stiff as well as the underground parking. But this is the closest to the Waikiki beach as your going to get for off the beach prices. Only 50 yards to the beach. There is a Teddy's Burger restaurant, Hula Bar and massage rooms on premises and a Starbucks next door. Priced right. to stay here.

First of all, this building has multiple units in it. I am only rating the Castle Resort owned/operated units NOT the private aparthotel units owned and rented out by private owners. I stayed in #704. Very nice room for a great price. I want to commend Roxy Cordero Front Desk Representative for going above and beyond in helping me with renting a room and a great parking space. She is cheerful, welcoming, efficient and runs a tight ship. Once again, BUYER BEWARE of units that are NOT owned/operated by Castle Resorts in the Waikiki Grand Hotel. Do NOT rent #318 or #817 which is owned and/or operated by Shay Property Management. Those rooms have many many problems and many complaints from other vacation renters of them and the management is off-sight who knows where and literally impossible to deal with. Kudos to Rob and Roxy for bailing me out of a really horrible experience in Unit/Studio/#817. Do NOT accept any assignment by Expedia or Hotels.com for a "One Bedroom in the Waikiki Grand". The apart/hotel studio unit may be in the same building - but it is NOT Waikiki Grand/Castle Resort property. There are other private units that might be fine - I do not know. Just know Castle management and unfortunately Shay very unprofessional management. Run, do not walk, away from Shay Property Management.

checked in just before midnight 17th jan 2015,security guard on reception,very nice and efficientt,i was in room 704,nice room, small, very comfy bed,table and four chairs,microwave,toaster,coffee machine,no balcony but i knew that in advance,great sundeck on the 10th floor.great view of the beach and diamond head,staff on reception were very nice,two of the reception staff did not know guests could cash cheques of up to $50 per day,but they quickly checked with management that it was ok,stayed here for 40 nights leaving on the 26th february,very enjoyable stay,going back next january.

We booked this thru Castle Resorts. Mistake.. I can't believe anyone even rated this property 3 stars. Old.. Ok, we can live with old if it's updated. The room we were in, which was charged as an ocean view kitchenette, was so small, the only seating was outside on the vey small balcony. Ocean view? We were facing the zoo and if we leaned over the balcony and looked right, behold, the beach. As we were checking out, at $224 + taxes and fees per night, a young man walked in off the street and was quoted $107 plus taxes & fees. I was told, when questioned, this was for city view. The clientele were questionable. The bar on the 2nd floor, also questionable. This is not a property I would EVER book on purpose. Do your homework. I didn't.

I recently spent one month holiday at this hotel. No one told me that on the second floor there was a gay bar called Hulas. So there was plenty of noise and action in the lounge with patrons going up to the bar?/!! The room that I rented had not been updated. It was your basic carpeted 1970s style with a microwave and small fridge but no cooking facilities. The building's hallways were spacious and clean and quiet. But beware of the noise of Waikiki which begins at 6:30 am. It is the noise of the garbage trucks and their "beep beep beep" noise of them backing up, which is very loud. The location of this hotel is great with its proximity to the zoo and to the beach. Next time, I will rent a room with cooking facilities though. One month is a little long to go without cooking//two weeks max. for me in future, Price was right at this condo. The interior of the building was very quiet and it felt safe. It took several communications with condo owner to get the wifi working. Laundry room is located in the basement and is convenient and cheap. If you rent here, be sure and use the rooftop patio and be careful of renting to close to the pub if you want to avoid noise until 2:00 am.

I stayed at their studio,clean, cute space with a balcony that has beach view.It has a small kitchen but I didn't have time to use any of it. It's 5 minutes walk to the beach, quiet at night since it's not on the main shopping street. Starbucks right downstairs and tons of CVS for your personal needs. Wifi service was unstable in my room though. I actually stayed one night at their regular room because I had to arrive one day early, the deco was kinda crazy and old fashioned, and condition was kinda old. I would only recommend the studio, and I really liked it.

An old property, with signs of renovation here and there. An effort is underway to sell off individual rooms as condos, therefore guests here may be renting someone's condo or a normal hotel room. Because it's old, the concrete jungle that is Waikiki has almost surrounded it and would have were it not for the fact that it's across the street from the zoo and adjacent park. This fact plus a rather pleasant 10th floor (the top) open balcony with good views are the positives. Otherwise, it's creepy and the airconditioners are of ancient design and cycle all night. We could not open a window in our room, which had a view of an unattractive pool and a parking lot.Not a good value.

The waikiki grand hotel is a correct hotel for waikiki.the situationis topbeach, restaurents and commerce just at your doorpeople are niceparking and internet freeeverything is closed and the personnel are always very nice

We had the best time here great view of Diamond Head and Waikiki Beach . The staff was very helpful and pleasant. I will come back to Oahu and when I do I am sure to stay here . The location is awesome .Aloha

We stayed in this building while renting a privately owned condo. As others have mentioned many of these rooms are privately owned and I believe in the future they will all be privately owned as I was told during my stay. We rented from a condo from VRBO and stayed on the 9th floor. The 9th floor is extremely quiet. We couldn't hear any noises from the hotel's bar. The location is great - on the quieter side of Waikiki. We rented a car and didn't have any problems with the parking garage. It is $17/day but was worth it to know our rental car was probably safe. Would definitely stay here again but only if we rented the same condo.

We stayed here one night on a layover and I must say it worked out ok for us. The location was perfect for us. We walked along the beach where the Royal Hawaiian is and it was a Friday night so there was lots of activity. There is a mall there where we had a wonderful meal. We were able to get a shuttle to and from the airport easily. However, this place is actually a condo/hotel which means many (most) of the rooms are actually independently owned. Bed was not comfortable and the air conditioner was loud so it made it hard to sleep with it on. There was a DOG next door that barked non-stop for over an hour. Finally after a couple of calls to the desk the guy came up and proceeded to knock on the door next door. I told him there was NO WAY anyone was in there with the barking dog but much to my dismay, a woman answered the door! That poor dog! We were on the 6th floor, so avoid that area.

Rooms are small and there is no parking, but you are 1/2 block to the beach. The buses run constantly and are very affordable, or you can park across the street at the zoo or at the Banyan for $12 a day. This really is a great location.

Great location but.....A. Window AC unit didn't work at 100%.B. Ceiling fan didn't have a light bulb.C. Assigned parking at $17.00 a day, and still every day for 6 days someone else's car was in our assigned stall. D. Maid service only cleaned room, made bed, replaced towels after 3 days. E. Day time front desk clerk (young women) need a lesson in costumer service, smile more and make guests feel welcomed. F. Free WiFi means dial up speed.

I just checked out of the hotel last Thursday. The location is why you stay here, folks....Across from the zoo...a block from the beach...within walking distance of Diamond Head...This is not a luxury property but my room (803) was recently remodeled and certainly met my standards. Yes, it is true that maid service is once every three deals...I say...Deal with it! You booked the place because it was amongst the most inexpensive...So don't expect to be catered to hand and foot....The location is the best...the staff is great and friendly...I come here every year and used to live here...Hula's on the second floor is one of my favorite bars and it makes for a short commute home. This is an island, folks, so there are cockroaches...though I didn't see any...I highly recommend and will return next year

We stayed for 3 nights only in room 718 the room was clean and comfortable nothing special but we only sleep there as we are usually out and about anyway. It has a kitchenette with everything you would need. Tv, Wifi, Hairdryer, Iron ect. The room has A/C which is good, and parking is available under the hotel for $17 per day.Location was great its walking distance to the beach and all the shops bars and restaurants.

This hotel appears to have been converted to some privately owned condos. The owner of #809 which we rented for 11 night was very kind and helpful. The building is old but well kept with a good elevator, laundry facilities, rooftop lanai, computer for printing documents, and reasonably good staff at the desk. The unit was clean, well equipped with good free wifi, fan and AC. The bed was reasonably comfortable but there was no sofa or chairs in the studio condo on which to sit to do our work as world travel writers. We brought in the table and two chairs from the lanai and that served our needs. We are used to staying in newer vacation homes and we were somewhat disappointed by the old feel of this property. But, the price was right for this for this period when we're moving on to three other islands to more upscale properties. No maid service is included although the owner offered to have towels and Keurig coffee pods replaced at no charge. We chose to wash the towels with our laundry but, we enjoyed the complimentary coffee. There's a busy bar on the second floor and a great hamburger joint in the building, Teddy's Burgers which we tried once and found to be good. Great sunsets and Waikiki beach are a one minute walk out the door. Great location.

We stayed in unit 919. Very clean and comfortable. Just a block from the beach. Located at a quiet end of Waikiki and a short walk to many activities. A kitchen was a big plus. The condos have a few parking spots for rent at a reasonable price for the area. The owner was most helpful and responsive.

It's now been 1 month since I stayed at the Waikiki Grand Hotel and my disgust has yet to subside. My Fiance and I cut our 7 day stay here short after 2 nights because of the large cockroach that was sleeping in our bed and the poor service that we received when we alerted the hotel staff. I'm talking about the rather rotund guy working the front desk. Not only did they handle the cockroach situation abysmally, "What do you expect lady, it's a tropical island? That's why we're also fumigating the rooms.", that's right, while we were staying there, they put up notices on all the rooms letting the guests know that they would be going in and fumigating; but the management also failed to contact us to apologize or speak with us about the large cockroach. The fact that management wasn't at all concerned about guests leaving because of roaches, should be a telling sign at the frequency with which this must happen. I waited to write this scathing review to see if maybe someone would contact me but no one obviously cares. I'd like to add that the guy working the front desk made the situation much worse. First he chastised us for not reporting the roach right away; we found the roach at 11pm and were exhausted and the next morning we had a tour planned super early, so we didn't report it until 3:30pm or so the following day. Then the front desk guy exasperatedly told us that it was a tropical island and we should expect to see bugs. All in all he was upset with us for even bringing it up. To make matters even worse, the first night we had also found a beetle in our sink, this didn't really bother us since it was a beetle and it was in the sink. And the air conditioner was 2 feet from our heads, so it was either freezing cold and right in our faces or extremely humid and stifling. We got no rest the first night, before the cockroach was even involved. This is supposed to be a vacation, don't spoil it by staying at this horrible place. Soo much money is spent on the flight and the hotel and the activities, why ruin it all?TL;DR: Large cockroach under the covers, fumigating the rooms, beetle in the sink, air conditioner pointed at our heads rendering it impossible to sleep, horrible service.

the staff at the desk were very helpful. i dont know waikiki very well so i dont know prices. once i stayed at the new otoni in an expedia room. it was a lot cheaper but smaller too. the room was small like a hotel room. we got this through "condo connections"and weve had great experiences with them in maui, so i expected more than this. but then i found out this was a hotel, so it works as that. location was great. on the zoo at the end of waikiki, so i was less crowded. in waikiki i would probably stay here again.

We were only staying in Honolulu for one night before going to the Kauai island so we wanted something cheap. Cheap is what we got. The carpet was so outdated and felt that way. The bed was uncomfortable. The sink was not in the bathroom but in the middle of the room that they consider a "kitchen" but it's so far from a kitchen. It appears they extended the room by possibly enclosing around what was previously a patio, so you could see on the ceiling and wall where the extension was made. Not a big deal, but the curtains did not fully cover the windows so that was inconvenient in the morning. Right outside the window we overlooked an apartment/housing unit that appeared less fortunate than others. I think the only reason for two stars is the location was right downtown and easy to get to and walking distance across the street from Waikiki Beach.

This hotel was in a perfect location. At the end of Waikiki Beach next to the Honolulu Zoo. Had a perfect view from my Balcony of Diamond Head, the zoo, and Waikiki Beach. The view was worth it. We stayed in unit 909 which is the 9th floor, the 10th floor is just a large sitting balcony with 2 or 3 rooms. On the 2nd floor of the hotel is a bar with live and jut-box music. On the 1st floor of the hotel is a burger place called Teddy's Burgers and they are awesome. They are busy but well worth the wait. Usually took our food to our room. The Wifi in the room was free. Only issue we had was our queen mattress was uncomfortable, we had a regular key for our room, and parking was a pain. I would have preferred keypad entry or a key pad lock so I didn't have to worry about losing our key. Parking in Oahu is a pain no matter what because you have to pay every where you park and the hotel has a few parking spots available for $18/day or next door the zoo has parking for $1/hr and metered parking on the streets. Other than those few issues, this hotel was in a perfect location with the best scenery.

I am not sure if this is the same company running unit # 318 at Waikiki Grand. I booked a room at the Waikiki Grand on June 5th, and I was surprised after I received the confirmation that a "Cleaning Fee of $170.94 per stay" is not included in the fee.I have booked a room for 3 nights from June 11-14 and the rate displayed $267.I read the conditions before booking and I do not recall reading anything regarding "Cleaning Fee of $170.94 per stay." The only excluded charge that I recall reading was the 13.96% tax.I tried to call the hotel directly to inquire and clarify the said fee but unfortunately, nobody was available to take my call, and their voicemail box was full and cannot receive anymore messages.I just sent them an email that evening and I was hoping to hear from them the next day. I think I've been duped when I was booking my hotel room at Waikiki Grand. I have used online booking services for my lodging previously, but this is the first time I've been given inadequate information before completing my booking.In addition, the condition regarding cancellation is not quite fair. It states, “Please note, if canceled, modified, or in-case of no-show, the total price of the reservation will be charged.”The next morning, I received a reply from the online booking service, and at first the managing director found the “Cleaning Fee” strange. After another exchange of email, I was informed that there are two properties at Waikiki Grand. One property is the hotel and the other is the condotel, and I have booked mine at their condotel/vacation rental.I also called Waikiki Grand based on the phone number posted online, but the person I spoke with did not have any information for me. She suggested I call the owner directly, but she doesn’t have the phone number. I also received an email from Waikiki Grand and was informed that they do not have any reservation under my name. I realized that there are different companies/owners running Waikiki Grand.I also emailed the other contact person for Vacation Rental at Waikiki Grand and she replied immediately, and even called me. Unfortunately, she cannot answer my question either. She is only in charge of checking in guests.When I arrived at Waikiki Grand on June 11th, I asked the receptionist regarding access to the condotel. I asked for the key and she simply said, “I don’t have the key. Just go there and put in the code.”I did not realize that the access code emailed to me was the code I need to punch in the electronic keypad to access room. I was not informed that there is no key required.When I got to the condo, I was disappointed because of the following:1. The door knob needs to be fixed. (This was fixed the next day). The rep claims that she had already called a week ago to have it fixed.2. The shelf is positioned infront of the air-conditioning.3. The curtain did not completely cover the window.4. There were two lights missing out of three in the headboard in the bedroom.5. There were two beds in the bedroom, upper and lower. I hit my head when I stood in the lower part (No, I did not stand on the bed). 6. The bedroom has a sliding door, which prevents the cool air from the a/c to get in. So I slept in the sofa bed in the living area. I did not use the bedroom at all.7. There were frozen food and ice cream left in the freezer, which were removed later in the afternoon after I reported it.8. I found a lighter in the couch.9. The couch appears to have seen better days.10. The shower curtain appears to have seen witnessed too many bodies. This needs a new one.11. This unit appears to be going through renovation. The drywall and the sliding doors haven’t been completely installed. 12. I can still see the painter’s tape in the divider.13. The water kept on dripping in the shower/tub, but the maintenance guy said, “It’s major work. Need to turn off the water in the building.” So I just did my best to turn it off after using, so as not to waste water.On the positive side:1. Great location!2. Bus stop is just a few steps away.3. The unit is on the quiet side.4. The internet is reliable and fast.5. Cable TV and Netflix are available.6. There are two refrigerators, which are both in good working conditions.7. The rep. (Shay Bowie) was polite and did her best to help. When I told her about the issues of the unit, she offered another unit where I can transfer, but I would have to pay again and not get a refund from this unit. When I brought up the cleaning fee, she justified that the dry cleaning of the comforter is already $50! But I am not interested in knowing the cost of the dry cleaning.Therefore, I do not recommend this hotel or vacation rental at all specifically unit 318… Had I known and read about the “Cleaning Fee” and the other maintenance issues, I would have booked a room at a different place.

Excellent place to stay! Room was very spacious on the fourth floor. It had everything I needed - a decent bathroom, television, fridge etc and came at a really affordable price. It was clean and secure. Location was excellent - close to transport, shops, food etc.The staff were really helpful, friendly and genuine people. Wish I could have stayed longer! I would go back in a heartbeat.

Ideally located, across from the zoo and a half a block from the beach, accommodating staff. The rooms need to be updated and their were roaches, which I guess is a problem in Honolulu. In walking distance of Kaimana beach which is where the locals go.

We stayed at room 511 with the view of the park of Honolulu Zoo and view of the diamond head.and overlooking the beach. we had the best time of our life. The room was clean and the bathroom size was perfect for the the two of us. We stayed for two weeks and we enjoyed a lot because it was a walking distance for the trolley to go to the mall. But they didn't changed our bed sheets for 6 days.

Just a quick comment- I had booked my room online and when I arrived, it turned out to be the second smallest room in the hotel /condo complex . Rob, at the counter , saved me by moving me for the remainder of my trip to a much nicer , larger, better appointed room with a view! In the future I will book directly with the hotel- thanks!

Room 511, the only complaint is the vertical blinds are trash, anyone sitting in park across street can easily see whoever or whatever is going on in the room at night when the blinds are "closed". The price of a decent curtain would be a wise investment.

My partner and had a great stay in 918 for a week beginning November 28, 2011. We liked it a lot. It was very well maintained, excellent bathroom and kitchen facilities, and the building has a wonderful deck one floor up overlooking the beach and Diamond Head. The location was perfect for us. It's on Waikiki, but toward the end and not at all congested. We often purchased food at a deli or restaurant and brought it back up to the deck. In addition there are many excellent restaurants nearby. Another person mentioned the building has a gay bar. Actually it is quite a nice, fun gay bar which we thoroughly enjoyed, but if you are not gay you will hardly notice it on the second floor. We would definitely rent this apartment again.

My family and I traveled to Hawaii in September 2013. We rented three units (all privately owned) from three different owners...all three experiences were different. My son and daugther in laws room was the envy! It was spotless, well appointed, nicely decorated and extremely comfortable. My daughter and son-in-laws room was a bit dated, but had all amminities and was very clean. Our room was dirty and had roaches! The linens were not fresh, the tub/shower was dirty...(you get the idea). I lived in Hawaii and also travelled there extensively. It was the first visit for all of my family-I am just grateful the kids got the better rooms...All that aside, even the construction did not interfere with our wonderful trip. We basically took over the roof top every evening to watch the sunset. My son-in-law and I had our morning coffee to watch to the sunrise up there as well. The location can not be beat...double rainbows greeted us daily. The club noise was not an issue, and there was a great "burger" place in the lobby. I would agree with the reviews below about the staff...they treated us as if we were not exsistant once they found out we "rented privately"...even general questions seemed to put them out (very rude!). Fortunately, I knew the island well and we knew the parking situations in waikiki, so we ignored them equally! My advise is to rent privately. *I did get my cleaning fee refunded by the owner of our unit. My family had a great vacation (of course had the girls seen a roach like I did it would have been all over!). I am an army brat and adapt quite well, so if you are not as flexible, this might not be a good fit for you. The price was affordable and I wanted the unobstructed view that is hard to find in Waikiki without paying premium dollar (I specifically picked three units facing Diamond Head). Bus line is right there, very convienient. (the homeless is a tragic epidemic that has evolved over the last several decades-huge difference from 1990 to 2013). We did not use the pool so I have no comment on it.

From the time of arrival to departure this place is HORRIBLE! From the very beginning when I arrived being advised by the security guard that the front desk is closed and if I didn't reserve parking then I'm out of luck, because there's no parking, that was the hint that I'm in for more possible bad things?* I had to park two blocks away carrying and rolling all our luggage, not happy!* I arrive to the room and was disappointed at the accommodation.* walked in a small circle and was grossed at the unit! why..... Previous guest hair stuck on the microwave with food grease marks, food splatter on the inside, sliding lanai glass door filthy with hand marks, smear marks of previous guests body oils and a lip mark that at first I thought was a sticker and it's not! The bed is slouching in the middle as in the ends of the bed is higher - didn't sleep well woke up many times and decided to just wake up at 5:30. The clock time was 4 hours off - the housekeeping staff should have fixed it when cleaning. I peeled the bedding back so much different kinds of hair DISGUSTING !!! And the bathroom was poor with black mold specks in the shower blah ! Save your time and choose a decent property, the word Grand in the property name is Totally Deceiving!

We chose this hotel off the web because it advertised that it was friendly to gay couples, and its location and pricing were within our budget. It's location is excellent, and all the advertising copy is impeccable. We arrived late (11 pm) after a long international flight, and there was a security guard attending the desk (actually, he wasn't attending the desk, and we had to wait a good 5-7 minutes for him to come back to the desk). We got our room code and arrived in a room that was not what we had booked (we'd book 'ocean view'; our room definitely was not), and was certainly disappointing. There was a very large pole in the middle of the room (see photo), which was at best inconvenient. I'm sure the room was very stylish in the early 1960s. The bed was squishy-soft (we both ended up with painful backs). The noise from the window air conditioners in nearby rooms was quite deafening. On reading the introductory material we received we discovered that the room would only be serviced every three days. We were there four, and never saw any kind of service, even to empty the rubbish bin (yes, just one). There was a TV (which remote did not function) and a refrigerator in the room. Bathroom was small but functional, as long as the shower drain was correctly aligned- otherwise the water accumulated and did not drain. And there were roaches, both small and large. We spoke with a manager about the roaches; he told us that the exterminator came monthly and was due in the next day or so. This is obviously not good enough. (Even in some remote Pacific island hotels I've stayed in at least they give you your own can of spray!) This hotel is well-situated a few metres from the beach, so it had the effect of making us go out and see the area. I also saw guests with animals, which was fine- I guess this is one of the places in Waikiki where you can stay with pets.The Waikiki Grand was undergoing renovations during our stay, and I can only hope that they lift their game soon. The website, advertising and literature about the hotel are excellent and very deceptive. Don't consider this place unless you are very, very desperate.
