review_body: Look when you go on holiday I know the idea is to just find a cheap place to sleep and immerse yourself in the local culture. This is the sort of hotel that not only wil ruin your holiday due to staff incompetence and general dirtiness of the hotel but will make you feel unsafe.I booked to stay here and after arriving slightly early waited for a while in the lobby and saw homeless people walking in the lobby and yelling and staff members being incredibly unprofessional and incompetent.There are plenty of nicer places on Waikiki and not even that much more expensive. Do yourself a favour and stay somewhere else because you flew all the way to Hawaii to have FUN and relax.

The Hotel was dirty, the surrounding area was dirty, the service was horrible. Would not recommend to any one. The hotel is very noisy. The working staff are lazy. The accommodation's and the photo's they advertise are very, very deceiving.

This was a great hotel for the money right next to the beach, centrally located. I would stay here when I go to honalulu. the rooms were clean, they have washer and dryers. they will give clean beach towels when you go to the beach

Nothing about it was good. Under reconstruction was the least of their problems. POOR front desk staff that made many mistakes with reservations two months in a row. I should have known better. You get what you pay for. Cold water and noisy air conditioner. Towels were like sandpaper

I stayed only 2 nights before heading to another island. The hotel is located across the Honolulu Zoo and only few minutes walk to the beach. The room is equipped with kitchen and Free Wi-fi in the room was helpful, too. I especially liked the excellent view of Diamond Head and the ocean. Only negative point is there is no housekeeping service during the stay. Otherwise it's good for budget travellers and I'd like to come back for a couple of nights.

The hotel is located half a block off the beach and across the street from the zoo. Many restaurants are close by. There is a pretty fun gay bar, Hula's, located on the 2nd floor, and a good hamburger joint is accessible from the lobby. Staff were pleasant, but seemed a bit confused with allocating parking. Be warned - their website indicates on-site parking is available, however, it is limited, and they do sometimes run out of parking spots. In room WiFi was free and worked very well. The property is extremely run down. The room was dingy and dank. The carpet, curtains, and bed linens were old and stained. Bath linens were old and in poor condition. Bath toiletries were good. I would not stay there again unless I was convinced the property had been completely renovated. Note that maid service reportedly only happens every 3 days. We stayed for 3 days, and received no housekeeping services at all.

I arrived at the hotel 9/13/13 around 4:00 p.m. with a reservation for me and my spouse. My two sons and daughter in-law helped us bring the luggage to the front desk. I gave the clerk my name and he said the reservation was for only two people as if we were trying to sneak three more people into the room. I told the clerk that one son was in the Navy there and my other son and his wife was staying in another hotel. I told him the name of the hotel and he said why didn't we book a room there because it was better than this one. After we checked in he gave us a room on the 4th floor which was very tiny and the windows had duck tape on them and the window air conditioner didn't work. On one of the plexi glass windows the duck tape had come off and it was a big gap between the plexi glass and window frame. I immediately went to the front desk and told the clerk about it and he moved us to a room on the 5th floor. The room was very small and the window air conditioner was noisy. I put up with noisy window air conditioner for two days and on third day I discovered that the microwave oven didn't work. I went to the front desk, luckily there was a different clerk on duty, and he gave us a room on the 10th floor. The room was very large with a kitchen. A day later we discovered it was roach invested.

We made a reservation 4 months ago for one of the best rooms they had.When we arrived to the hotel, they assigned us the worst room. The room was above the ventilation system, it was noisy, a room where you couldn't have a rest. We talked with them and they changed the room, same position but 3 floors up... the same noise... We talked again to get a room on the other side, but, It was under construction!! OMG!!Finally we cancelled the room, because they didn't give us the service we had payed.The worst happened when we had to pay one night because of the cancellation... we pay for a service they didn't give us... horrible and poor...We went to Pacific Beach Hotel, same price and better service.

Even if it is going a renovation i had a wonderful time staying there,a very clean hotel with a great staff who is very helpful to leave their desk to assist you with any issue since i had one with the wifi,the kitchenette is an essential area for me with the fridge and the view on the beach is awesome,one block away to walk to it and surf the waves since there were,i like the location and the design of the room.

Last minute flights and never been to Hawaii before left us running for a place.... As it turns out extremely pleased with accommodation for 9 nights. Reading other peoples experiences left us nervous but staff were GREAT, location BRILLIANT, external noise QUIET, room presentation TIRED but clean. Negatives were AC is windows rattler type and so it was noisy. Building is being painted but that was advertised and was not an issue. Certainly would stay again BUT seems it's a room by room situation based upon other feedback. We were in 911. For new people to Waikiki, this is the end to stay at - other end is concrete jungle. If you want 5 star - NO - good 2-3 star accommodation. VERY helpful and accommodating staff. Pool tired but great!

We are a family of 3, & stayed here for 1 night before heading up to the N. Shore. Hotel was very nice for the price. Staff was great! Beautiful murals on walls. We were a bit out of place as a "family," but we were o.k. with it. Was great value and location was nice too! Keep an open mind with this place! :) We would gladly go back.

My husband and I just returned from a wonderful weekend stay in room 509. The view of the Zoo, Kapiolani Park, the beach, and Diamondhead were fantastic. If we had planned on staying longer we definitely would have utilized the kitchenette that included a large refrigerator, a two burner stovetop, a microwave, toaster, utensils, etc, and of course a coffeemaker. As it was, Starbucks was a great friend. The room was comfortable, I slept great. Wifi was free. The staff was responsive and friendly. A light bulb went out and they were there in ten minutes to fix it. It was $17 for parking per day but it is convenient and worth it in Waikiki. Hula's was a nice relaxing place to have a mai tai or two.The only thing I would change for our next visit it to get a room with a lanai, even if it might cost a bit more. Overall, I would recommend staying at this hotel if you're looking for an affordable place to stay.

We stayed in room 909 in the Waikiki Grand for 10 nights in April 2013. The location was fantastic, about a 3 minute walk to the beach, the room was small but we didn't spend a lot of time there. What we had planned to do was spend a lot of time on the balcony admiring the stunning views of Diamond head and the ocean but were unable to do so due to the fact there was on-going maintenance to the front of the building which the owner of the unit had failed to tell us about. For most of our stay the balcony was covered in dust, dirt and rubble, we couldn't even leave any damp towels outside to dry. We did raise the issue with the owner but all she offered was to move us to a room at the rear of the hotel without the view we had paid for. There seemed to be a lot of maintenance going on in Honolulu during or stay, my advice would be to check with individual hotels to see when their annual maintenance is scheduled. The location of the hotel is also quite noisy, rubbish collection is very early and the wagons very noisy, air con is old and noisy too. Overall or experience at this hotel was positive, staff were friendly and helpful, the room was clean but did lack amenities, there was no phone and kitchen equipment was sparse, the internet was a bit hit and miss too. However for the price I don't think you'd find a better location in Honolulu.

This hotel is perfect for the traveler on a budget. Our room was under $100 a night and was a 30 second walk to the beach. We had a kitchenette (free upgrade), which allowed us to prepare several meals which we were able to eat inside our ocean view room (with balcony). There is no daily housekeeping. The open air bar on the second floor is a great value (we went every night) and is open late, offering $10 pitchers of various drinks. On several nights, there is a cover charge that starts at 9pm, so check in advance. Rooms with an ocean view also face the Honolulu Zoo! We were able to watch the flamingos and elephants from our room every morning. Staff is very accommodating and helpful, and checked us in at 10am in the morning. For the money and location, this hotel is unbeatable.

The reviews seemed pretty hit/miss, but our stay was awesome. We were upgraded on arrival to oceanview with a kitchenette. No house keeping for 5 nights, but at $75 a night I can sweep and reuse a towel! Complimentary drink coupons for the 2nd floor bar brought us back every night. Mai Tais were fabulous and the staff was a delight. Half a block from the beach, and location is everything! We were in 811 and could see the flamingo exhibit from our lanai. Pretty cool. The outside is currently under renovation, but it makes for a great deal. I found the best deal on their own website. Very helpful front desk staff. I really can't say enough good things!

We stayed at the Waikiki Grand Hotel right across the street from the zoo and 1/2 block from the beach. We had a beautiful view of Diamond Head and a partial Ocean view. The room was small but comfortable, had a fridge, microwave, coffe maker and a 2 element stove, so we were able to save further by cooking/making a lot of meals in our room. The top floor has a great large balcony with a wonderful ocean view. We could have happy hour at Hula's, a "boutique" bar on the 2nd floor or byob to the top floor balcony.The room was cleaned and towels changed ever few days. The cleaning staff was very pleasant.The man at the front desk, Brent, was very helpful, friendly, considerate and polite. He was a good source of information and helped to make our stay very pleasant. He went out of his way to provide us with excellent service. We have stayed at this hotel before and will stay again next year. I'd recommend it. However it is not a 5 star hotel, it is an economy one and worth the price.

I am a retired travel agent and have just spent two months at this property. I never once had any problems or issues with our unit or the hotel. The hotel employees as well as the manager were most gracious and always greeted us with a warm ALOHA. These units are individually owned and therefore each unit is different. I highly recommend that you use VRBO and search for the units that are managed by Charles. He lives in the building and will make you feel most welcome and very much at home. We stayed in unit 714 and will hopefully go back to this unit yearly. If you want the Ritz Carlton go on down the road and pay for it, if you want a cozy room for a reasonable price, go to VRBO where you can see what you will be getting and book through them. The hotel prices are higher and you can not see what you will be getting. I must say that the only room that we would recommend staying in would be the lanai's over looking the zoo and diamond head.

Arrived to find no-one at the front desk. I went to have a cigerette on the front steps while my husband tried to checked us in. Waited about 20 minutes and finally a security guard same to the desk and told us we were lucky he came down when he did because desk service ends at 10:00 pm. Told us the internet was hit and miss but we were on vacation so it didn't matter. Went to our room and opened the door.The smell was unreal. The sheets had hair and other things that I can't begin to describe. There was no phone and one tiny lamp to light the room. The room was just filthy. Soap in the bathroom had hair on it. My husband and I left to find another hotel and thank God we were able to find one on a Friday night. We went back and got our luggage and went to the front desk were the security guard was sitting and told him we were checking out and all he said was okay. We had been re-assured over the phone a few days before we arrived that we were getting one of the better rooms. If this was one of the better rooms I do not want to see the worst. I hope Priceline takes this hotel off their list. We are hoping that are credit card company will help us fight this.

review_body: This unit had a very large sleeping area with a comfortable king size bed, living and , dining room right on the beach. One whole wall was a glass view of the beach and park! I choose the junior suite to get the upgrade for a full kitchen, which we greatly enjoyed. We had breakfast on the balcony overlooking a park, a view of the city + hill, and ocean. The appliances were older and the building an original gem. We were walking distance to the shopping, but you really needed a car to get groceries for the kitchen. PARKING WAS AVAILABLE for a price. This was probably the nicest part of our whole vacation in Honolulu, as shopping areas were crowded with young tourists. I wish that we had spent a day in this lovely room and skipped one of our tourist outings! All the other more expensive hotels were huge, crowded, and locked in next to each other without the view afforded by this older, smaller, gem. The Trump Tower is actually BEHIND this building!

I have and continue to stay at the Waikiki Grand but have learned to stay in the Units maintained by Charles G. I recommend only one unit: 414. It is updated with a new lanai, kitchen, bath and wall air conditioner. Charles worked on cruise ships and runs four or five units in the building. That's the secret of staying at the Waikiki Grand. Find units well maintained by people like Charles who understand hospitality. Otherwise you will end up in some of the rooms that people complain about. Another tip: stay away from the third floor above Teddy's burgers or Hula's. Although both are great businesses, it seems like most of the plumbing problems happen in the rooms on the 3rd floor....one floor above Hula's and two above Teddy's Bigger Burgers. I am not blaming them for anything, just noting the problem. Right now building is going on, outside of the building. So be aware of noise and dust from 8:30 am - 4:00pm daily. This will go on for some time.

I truly believe it's a roll of the dice at this place since each unit is individually owned, but managed by Castle. I bid on Priceline and was impressed with the price I got for a room in Waikiki and didn't even think to review this place, but something nagged at me to take a look. I looked at every way possible to get out of my reservation after reading the mostly negative reviews, but unfortunately I was locked in. My fiancee tried to reassure me that maybe we would get one of the rooms that were positive. In the 20 years I served in the military, my travels have taken me all over the world and throughout the US and I have to say that even the road-side motels that line the Interstates have been better!Pros (because I think I should find some good in everything): Location, location, location. The room appeared to be clean. Cons: The check-in was pleasant enough except when I asked about the $17/day parking fee and was told that "the parking garage is pretty slammed full tonight, but I can reserve something for you tomorrow... Oh wait your leaving tomorrow." It seemed she expected me to just initial off on it and she never suggested where I should park for the night. We went up to the room (515) and the first thing we noticed was a putrid smell in the room. My fiancee thought it was the toilet backed up or something, but I have experience in this odor as a rat died in a crawl space at work and we had to live with this same smell for a week. Since it was late and we were leaving early in the morning (we live on a neighbor island and were there only for a concert) we decided to just go with it since there was no night manager available. We were located above the hotel bar and needless to say we didn't get much sleep! The shower was clean enough, however by the time I was finished with my shower there was 6 inches of water in the tub. As I was checking out I informed the guy at the front desk about the smell along with the many burned out light bulbs and he seemed to get defensive at first, probably thought I was trying to get discount or money back, but when he saw that I wasn't he then pretty much blew me off.Unfortunately I would not recommend this to anyone, nor will I be staying here when I next visit Oahu unless Castle requires the individual owners to invest some money in fixing up the units and establish some type of uniform standard. I will be dropping a comment to both Castle corporate office as well as Priceline.com to remove them from their listing.

It was our second trip to Hawaii, and we were on a budget. We saw a review for 904 and it was spot-on. Super Clean; Hawaii paintings; nice carpet and bedding and smelled fresh & clean -it was quite wonderful. Yes, the room was small, but it was a 1/2 block from the beach and furnishings (with a wet bar) made it an excellent stay. Overall the hotel is small, but the service, location and room 904 make staying in paradise, well, Paradise !!

Hotel itself was a bit dated and the AC was noisy and needed to be on or it got really hot in the room. We had a balcony room which was fantastic, had coffee in the morning looking out over the beach. Went to the zoo which was great, BBQ at the beach diner, breakfasts at Wolgang Puck's express. Checked out the International Market. Wanted to enjoy the beach so didn't go to Pearl Harbour or Polynesian Cultural Center which I'm sorry we missed. Only here 3 nights so the small room wasn't an issue. Price was right!

Originally made review 08/19/2012. Castle Waikiki Grand Hotel response was pretty much - they tried to help us but nothing was good enough. I previously responded but my response was not posted. In simple words, no one helped us. There was no manager on duty for 3 or 4 days and no one contacted us. After almost 7 months we finally were able to get a refund from our travel agent. The responses they post to unhappy people are standard. I would also like to state for the record, I have Stage 4 cancer and have learned to take life in stride. I don't like to complain but find the positive from all bad. This hotel - there was no good! Please don't stay here. We did end up finding a place to stay and had a wonderful time. My husband felt we were there and didn't want our vacation ruined. No guarantee I'd ever be able to travel again. I had never been in Hawaii. I'm very surprised this hotel has not been condemned. Besides the people we dealt with at the hotel, the other businesses, the locals, and the scenery were extraordinary. I told my husband, if possible, I would love to return. Life is short and it is a shame a business can get away with such service and lies!

We stayed in Room 304 from 02/26/13-03/01/3. I will list the Pros first. Really close to Waikiki beach, Honolulu Zoo and the Park. There is a fastfood restaurent adjacent to the Hotel. The music from the Bar on 2nd floor was not an issue. Multiple eateries close by. There is free parking on Monsarrat Ave and free overnight parking (6pm-7am) on Kapahulu Ave. There is a paid parking lot across the hotel which is $1/hr. Now I will list the Cons and why we won't be booking Room 304 again. Each room is maintained differently. The one we stayed had a terrible view and just looked cheap and dirty. It was one of the cheapest rooms that we found near Waikiki beach and upon entering the room, we discovered why it was priced the way it did. Either way, we will not be booking this hotel or this room again.

review_body: DO NOT STAY HERE! We booked this hotel online and it looked pretty good for the price and location. ...location is pretty good but that's it. We were assigned room 406, which is mentioned in other reviews. We were supposed to stay 6 nights but checked out and found another hotel after a day and a half. I am not a picky person but the room was disgusting! There was day light between the window and outside wall, duct tape on the air conditioner and around the floor in the bathroom and I killed 3 large bugs in the room in the short time we were there. EWWW! I tried to shower the first night but the drain didn't work so I was left standing in 12" of sandy water. Also, we were supposed to have a queen bed but had a double and there is a large pillar in the center of the room right up next to the bed. The furnishings are odd and mismatched. We returned to our room after the first day to find it had not been touched. The bed wasn't made, there was sand on the floor and our dirty towels were still there. When I inquired at the ftont desk I was informed they only clean every 3 days! That is unacceptable!! I am paying for a service and at least expect clean towels. To add to all of that the room did not have a coffee maker, blow dryer or ironing board. A HORRIBLE place to stay! Do not be fooled by their website. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else. We moved to the Queen Kapiolani next door which is wonderful.

Avoid room 406. My sister and I had a reservation for two nights (2/7/13 to 2/9/13) and ended up leaving after the first night. The bed is not a queen, which is what was stated on our reservation, but a full. Upon seeing this, we thought we had the wrong room. Went down to the front desk and the gentleman working said we had a queen bed. Yeah, I'm pretty sure I know what a queen bed is since I own one. The wireless internet signal did not exist, either. Four devices could not find it. Even searched for hidden signal. The worst part was the noise from the plexi-glass windows that were taped together to support the air conditioner. The cracking sounds made it incredibly hard to sleep. I am pretty sure this a/c and window setup is probably a hazard. Definitely not stable. As soon as morning came, we sought out different lodging, which was almost impossible to find since it was a Friday night in Waikiki. My sister and I packed up our stuff and checked out early. Front desk gentleman did waive the parking fee for us and did apologize for our inconvenience and early departure. Whoever owns this little room is a con artist and should be ashamed of themselves. A refund would be incredibly appreciated.

Where to begin. I have never written a review positive or negative but I am doing this to spare anyone else the horrible experience my husband and I had. We stayed at this hotel in room number 406 on Feb.6th, 2013 I walked in and was mortified that this was actually a room being charged over $150 a night. To begin: I pulled down the bed cover to find the top sheet stained with oil, or something and the pillow having long black hairs on it. I took the sheets down to the front office girl and showed her the stains and she brought up a new set, that we had to make up. The bed was a full size and when you sat on the bottom of the bed it felt like it was broken in the center. The mattress cover was inside out and very poorly fitted, way to big for the bed. In the middle of the room was this huge concrete structure that butted up to the bed. Horrible. If the bed was not bad enough the noise was ridiculous. There is small window air conditioner that is jerry rigged on the diagonal in the window with plexiglass ducked taped into the frame. It that worked but was so loud. Just below the very dirty large windows that would not open for fresh air were numerous pool/air conditioning units. They too ran all night long and were very noisy.The shower tub combination did not drain so my the time you finished showering you were standing in 18" of water. The towels were clean but random colors and style. No hair dryer, drinking cup, even plastic. The t.v remote did not work but it did not matter because you had to put the t.v. so loud to hear over the drone of all the equipment that is was not worth it. I never slept one wink the entire night. My husband stuffed his ears with cotton and put the pillow over his head and got a small amount of sleep. The furniture is the cheapest most random combination of stuff. This is the epitome of what you would call a slum lord. My understanding is that the rooms are individually owed, like condos, and rented out. The hotel simple manages the rooms. The owner of this room owes us a refund and an apology. The $30 credit off the $175.00 bill was not the least bit adequate for the condition of this room. Deplorable. I took pictures or everything. I am not sure if I will contact the fire department or someone because I believe most of this room is not up to code and could actually be a death trap. I feel ripped of and bummed that having waited 30 years to get back to Hawaii my final night there was this memory. Please shut down this room and do not let anyone else have this terrible experience.One more thing....you get in and out of this room by pressing four numbers into a lock on the outside of the door. It did not feel secure or safe.

I don't know where the previous tenants stayed but it wasn't the same 315 we stayed in. Arrived on Jan 17 and stayed till the beg of Feb. For us it is PRIORITY ONE - LANAI and functioning kitchen which is great to keep costs down and this had best of both. We arrived to a very clean updated unit. The photos that are on the site for both units owned by Alice (Sun-N-Snow vacationrentalretreats) are exactly what you get and see inside and out on the lanai.Located at the quieter end of Waikiki but the bus stops right outside at the corner and you are right next to the zoo which limits the traffic compared to right downtown. We specifically chose this side of the Grand because of the beach view and being next to the zoo. There was granite countertops, a apartment size stainless steel refrigerator(which is invaluable) updated cupboards, cutlery,dishware,several useful appliances including blender,coffee maker, rice cooker etc. many bowls, salad spinner, pots and pans, plastic wrap etc . the list goes on and on.  Have stayed in the Grand multiple times in multiple units and this was one of the nicest. Last year the unit we had stayed in on the seventh floor was old outdated and filled with roaches but this unit (yes it is small but you aren't there to stay in the room) was neat and didn't feel dated and only saw one roach the whole trip.  The murphy bed was comfortable and attention was made to detail when it came to matching towels which were plentiful and bedding which was new and the lanai had a decent set of outdoor furniture not cheap white plastic chairs.  Also, on the lanai in a large deckbox is everything you could want for a day at the beach including Tommy Bahama chairs which made us the envy of our friends that had to bring theirs from home. Boogie boards, snorket equipment etc.... And there is room darkening curtains.Only complaint is that the pocket door was indeed a problem which if you weren't travelling with someone you were comfortable enough to leave the door open with then you would have to fight with it to close and open, and the airconditioner is right at bed level and try as we might we couldn't get the wifi in the room to work, but at least it was a updated TV.  Nice that dishsoap was provided and spices galore in the cupboard and ice was ready when we arrived in a very clean refrigerator. Had to call owner once while there about telephone restrictions and she called me right back - at least you have an in-unit telephone to make any local and 1-800 calls which was really convenient and with a calling card you can call anywhere in the comfort of your room.We would stay here again in a minute, would prefer the owner's unit on the 9th floor only for a better beach view but it was a pleasure dealing with this owner from booking on and you are always worried about being scammed but this owner obviously doesn't operate on Hawaiian time because she is always prompt to sent info etc.

I highly recommend NOT staying in room 322!!!He is a very dishonest person that will probably screw you over too. I'm sure all of the other rooms are OK and the location is great but if you no whats good for you I would stay away from THAT room!

I stayed here last year & was not disappointed with this return visit. The quality of the rooms vary greatly as they are owned by individual owners. Both times I stayed in rooms in the hotel pool, & maid service is every 3rd day, but you can get clean towels & soap from the front desk. WiFi in the room was hit & miss, but I could always get WiFi in the lobby. The location of this hotel is convenient to the beach & Honolulu Zoo. I had a city view room with a kitchenette, & I live downtown so am used to urban noise, but the garbage trucks always woke me up at 7 am! I would stay here again.

I'd read some pretty negative reviews of this property, but I ended up with a more than satisfactory room that was way better than I expected. I got a large efficiency style room equipped with a full kitchen that was very large and very nicely appointed. It had everything I needed for a very comfortable stay. There were only 2 negatives: first, very old-style jalousie windows made for extremely noisey nights of never ending traffic sounds, service vehicles, motor bikes, and trash trucks all night long. You can't get any sleep without earplugs. So if you're looking for quiet and serenity, forget this place or anywhere near by. The AC helped drown out a little of the traffic noise but the jalousie windows are a total waste of energy since they don't seal shut anywhere. Second, the floor was FILTHY. Cleaning service is only once every 3 days, and they only do the minimal necessary. The bathroom was clean, but the rest of the place was questionable. Bring a full container of disenfectant wipes - you're gonna need them. Otherwise, the security on the property was excellent, with continual camera monitoring of all the floors and corridors. The laundry facility was also very good and convenient, and the front desk is happy to make change for the coin operated washers and the dryers. Neighborhood-wise, the location is ideal, with plenty of ABC stores just a few steps away, a Starbucks on the corner, plenty of restaurant choices, and the beach, zoo, aquarium, and Queen Kapiolani Park just a 5-10 minute walk away. It's a perfect location for those who want an "urban" beach experience, but who don't want to be right in the thick of downtown Waikiki. Overall, a nice experience and I would stay here again.

review_body: Located on the east end of Waikiki across from the Honolulu Zoo and less than a five minute walk from Queen Beach, the Waikiki Grand is a no frill, great bargain hotel in Waikiki.If you are looking for all the normal amenities and frills of a typical resort hotel then this may not be the place for you.However, if you want affordable simple accommodation in Waikiki then the Waikiki Grand may suit your needs. I stayed three nights on the 9th floor in a basic room with outdated furniture, a bathroom that could be updated with new plumbing and carpeting that could use a good cleaning or be replaced. Nonetheless, I was not disappointed with my stay.The room had a comfortable bed, small refrigerator, a balcony, air conditioning and free wi-fi. Since this is basically a time share condo, I understand each room is different. During my stay the hotel was relatively quiet although there is a bar and nightclub on the second floor. There is also a popular burger restaurant on the lobby level.In reading previous reviews, mention was made of this being a popular gay/lesbian hangout. The only way I knew that maybe the case is due to a Rainbow Flag flying from the second floor which could just as easily have been there because Hawaii is often known as the “Rainbow State”. In my opinion any issue with it being a gay/lesbian hangout is a non issue and should not affect anyone's decision to stay here.The Waikiki Grand does not offer daily maid service but the front desk is more than accommodating for any special needs. Although if you ask for an ironing board you will just get that without the iron, so ask for the iron too. There is also laundry facilities available on the property.For about US$100 per night booked through Priceline, I thought I got a great deal and will definitely be staying at Waikiki Grand again and again. Mahalo, Waikiki Grand!

Our experience with this hotel left a lasting impression but not in a good way. To start we had booked a room that was privately owned through VRBO and unfortunately had to vacate the room due to bed bugs. This is by no means the fault of the hotels as the private rooms are the responsibility of the owner but we were informed later that the bed bugs situation was an issue throughout the hotel. In a scramble to find a new place to stay for the remainder of our vacation we checked with front reception to get a room with the hotel to ease the burden of lugging our luggage around. We checked two different rooms and they were horribly filthy. The carpets were stained, the bedding looked dirty and the furniture was very outdated and all of this for a very high price. We ended up hauling our luggage down the street. Very unpleasant experience for our first trip.

We rented this condo from being advertised on HomeAway. I read every review and looked closely at each photograph. I am very familiar with this area, so knew exactly where it was, which is just ideal. You are literally steps from Waikiki Beach .. fewer steps to a Starbucks and an ABC store. Go round the corner to Kalakaua and the world is at your doorstep.This is an interesting condo complex ... a combination of short term rentals and folks who actually live there. It is a pet friendly place ... saw many dogs, and there is even a Guard Cat ... Scruffy .. on premises.Our unit was perfect for our needs. Only a studio, but well appointed and very comfortable. It was exactly as promised in HomeAway. We had no view, but if we wanted, we could go up to the 10th floor which is an observation deck and see the World of Waikiki, including Diamond Head.The staff was friendly ... the elevators worked quickly and well ... we were just a minute from the bus stop ... yes, we would return. Also, there is good security, which we discovered when we had to leave for the airport at 4AM!

First of all, I have seen all the negative things written on this hotel. I will comment on my room which was clean (although a bit small), the bed was very comfortable. Considering its location: at night there was very little street noise (my room was facing Diamond Head). There is a gay club on the second floor--so if you are homophobic--better not stay at this hotel. I had no problems with any of the clientele (either from the hotel or the club--all were very friendly. Front desk personnel were very friendly and helpful. Honolulu Zoo is right across the street (I could hear lions roar occasionally at night--pretty cool). Honolulu aquarium is in walking distance. Waikiki beach is 5 min. away. Shops, restaurants, ABC store, night clubs were just minutes away (walking). The best feature of the hotel is location. Btw the bus stop almost in front of the hotel (and bus service is excellent in Honolulu--no need to rent a car). There is also a sundeck on the 10th floor that is open to all guests. There is also free wifi and a pool (although we never used it with the wonderful beach just minutes away. There is also a very tasty burger place on the firs floor (Teddy's).

This was by far the worst place I have ever stayed in. The rooms are dated, and need maintenance. The rooms are the dirtiest I have ever seen. I can't believe they have notbeen shut down. The best thing about this place is checking out!!!

Location, location, location. This hotel is in my favorite spot in Waikiki. It has a nice lobby, free wifi, a cute little diner called Teddy's Burgers. We had the most inexpensive room, and it was basic, but clean and roomy enough. I especially liked that it had a separate room leading into the bathroom with a fridge, microwave, assorted dishes and glasses, and a separate sink from the bathroom. I peered into some of the better rooms and they looked pretty nice. The staff at the front desk were helpful and nice. So, 5 stars for location and price. 3 stars for the room.

Disgusting, Filthy, Service Horrible ----- Saw two rooms - Yuck!!!!! Can't afford another hotel. They won't help.with sister hotel. Flying back to.Calfornia tonight. Better than staying in this.filth!!!!!!

Because these are individually owned and maintained condos, they are not consistent. Some are just lovely and others are marginal. However, we have stayed here several times and the one time that there was a problem the management immediately moved us to another unit. It is nice to have a kitchenette and some of the rooms have balconies which makes for a good place to put the sandy beach toys to dry off. The prices are also extremely reasonable.The location couldn't be better! Walking distance to the beach. There is an ABC store right next door and several nice eating places also within walking distance. The zoo across the street gives you something different to do if you get tired of the beach. This is a great little spot at the end of the beach hotel area which makes it a little quieter and less crowded.This is our "go to" place whenever we visit Oahu which is every year or two.It is great for a casual visit if you don't need amenities such as room service and fine dining in a standard hotel.
Dirty rooms, stained carpets and no maid service. There are many better options for a room near Waikiki beach.

I would like to recommend Waikiki Grand to anyone traveling to Oahu and staying in Waikiki. Rooms are great (always ask to visit first and before paying), prices are reasonable, staff is fantastic and location is perfect: one block from the ocean... nice corner of the seafront with Starbucks, surfschool, convenient store, etc. and everything else just a stroll away. i spent a week surfing and worknig in Hawaii and used Waikiki Grand as my base. It was just awesome.

Got a room half price on a deal email. Looked nothing like website. Dirty, noisy, airconditioner blowing on me as I lied on the bed. Uncomfy bed and smelly balcony and bathroom. Never seen anything so horrible. Was supposed to be a $210 room too - no way was it worth that. Thank god the Hyatt around the corner took us in. At least I got a refund.

I booked a Castle managed room and it was great. For the price point and location, it's an awesome deal! I got room 703 facing the back, very quiet. The unit is in decent shape. Clean bed, and bathroom! The hotel is literally 1 min walk to Waikiki beach!

well where do I start,,,In my opinion this was not a 2 bdroom as advertised one of the bdrooms it had a pull out folding door , The woman at the front desk had no idea about the free amenity we were intitled to as the ads says FREE amentiies to 50plus years old and all of us were over 50. As for 2 couples u would think they could have given us 2 double beds not 1 dble and 2 singles

All i can say is this is the most horrid hotel I've ever stayed at and after one night, I moved to Ala Moana Hotel. I stayed here in August 2011. The carpet was STICKY with god knows what? The bed was clean, but it was so noisy (we had the room above the rubbish collection) and after a sleepless night because of all the noise from the traffic etc I managed to sleep for about two hours and practically JUMPED out of bed in the morning thinking the garbage collector was right above my head or something, it was THAT loud! I couldn't stay another night there, it was as good as sleeping on the street!

I will first start by saying that this location was falsely advertised in every way. Photos on this site do not represent this unit (or the pool). The unit is extremely small and cluttered. It was so dirty with visible stains on the couch and patio chairs. We placed our own towels down to sit. The bathroom door was initially slid closed that I had to get help from the front desk to open it. The bathroom floor had hair and dirt that was in every corner. Expect no help from the front desk due to their disinterest in the unit. We paid for parking only to find frequently someone else parked in our spot. The pool is tiny and hidden between concrete buildings (ugly!). We left halfway through our stay as we couldn't stand it any longer. This unit is also right above the bar so don't expect to have and quiet evenings.

We walked into the room and immediately was disappointed. The windows had vertical blinds where almost half of them were missing which provided almost no privacy to the many buildings that faced the room. The kitchen area was a mish mash of various items of differing design eras. The couch was a faded velvet gold from the seventies which allowed you to sink half way down the floor when you sit in it. The overall appearance of the room was dirty, unkempt, and poorly maintained. The only good point about the hotel its proximity to the beach and restaurants.I strongly advise you to take a different hotel despite of its less expensive prices.

I was quite surprise that this place did not get a high rating. Condo:Our Lanai had a great view of Diamond Head, Honolulu Zoo and a bit of the beach.The Bachelor pad was perfect for my Boyfriend and I. It was very very clean and newly renovated. The receptionists were also quite helpful if you ever needed any assistance.Location:Everything was so closed by.... Diamond head was about a $12 cab ride, 1 min walk to the beach and there's an ABC store beside it for any everyday needs you may requireI would recommend to stay at this place to everyone!
we rented a condo herer from a private real estate professional. the location is great, but that was about it. the inside was old, the a/c very loud and the sink clogged.

From check-in to checkout, the staff was outstanding. The television remote control was missing from my room when I checked in, and all of the staff members went out of their way to locate a suitable remote control for a flat panel television that seemed to be missing its brand name and model. One of the staff made a special trip to Wal-Mart to purchase a remote, and then took the time to program it to work with the television. The location is outstanding: just a couple hundred feet from the Waikiki Beach. The housekeeper kept the room clean and well stocked with towels and other amenities. This was the third time that I have stayed at the Waikiki Grand, and my experience there seems to improve with each stay. I hope to return later in the year!

Check out their website www.myhawaiibeachfront.com click on Oahu, this suite is Waikiki Le Ale A. As the website indicates, the views from the outside deck are spectacular. The suite is small, but perfect for a couple - you can squeeze in a small child, but no more. The kitchen was recently renovated and the large lunch counter was great. 2 small fridges, a toaster, small stove and microwave were included.Not a luxurious building, but the price was right and you have everything you need. 2 elevators, laundry facility in basement and parking is reasonable. The staff were helpful and the neighbors were friendly.The tiny pool is between the hamburger restaurant below & another building - practically never used. The beach close-by is ideal with good shade and a lifeguard on duty. All in all, we enjoyed our stay and we got to tour the whole island, which is what we set out to do. I would say for a week it was worth it, but do not expect anything high-end!

Waikiki Grand is excellent when it comes to location and affordability! I was pleased with the views and location. The hotel itself has private owners per unit. Our unit was cozy and charming with it's decor and trim including the crown molding and fixtures. The owner did a great job providing us with everything from towels to cooler and boogie boards. There was a very entertaining night club at the hotel (for very open minded people such as myself) which plays excellent club music has some fantastic bartenders and served me the best mojito martini money can buy!!! The laundry room is in the basement and is clean and affordable- overall good clean friendly place located in south Waikiki that I felt safe and comfortable in!!

I have stayed at the Waikiki Grand before but this time I found the place lacking in ways where it simply shouldn't be. This is a hotel on the more budget end of the scale so I don't expect the standards of a hotel like the Moana Surfrider. However, I found the staff here surly, unaccommodating and lazy. Both the main desk guy and the young woman spend their time sitting, glued to a computer and only bother to look up when you ask them a direct question. So much for the Aloha hospitality! The room, while obviously renovated was disappointing - no balcony with windows that didn't open. They were so filthy you could barely make out Diamond Head or the beach views. The air-conditioning was noisy and too powerful for the size of the room. The remote to the TV didn't work. I have stayed in Hawaii many times and really think it is worth spending a bit more and staying at a hotel other than the "Grand". As each room is individually owned you can never be sure of the facilities. The room is only serviced every 3-4 days and they don't even renew the soap or shampoo even though I was there for a week. The most disappointing part of the experience is the uninspiring staff who fail to understand that their job security is dependent on tourism not just the residents who live there permanently. You can do better for your staff in Waikiki.

I cannot understand some of the negative comments. This was my fifth trip to Honolulu, & the first time I have stayed at the Waikiki Grand Hotel, & I will definitely stay here again. I spent 13 nights in Room 516, which was booked through the hotel pool. This is a condo hotel, & some rooms are booked through individual owners, so the quality & condition can vary greatly. My room was serviced every 3rd day. There were a few problems with the room I had, nothing earth shattering but I let the front desk know when I checked out, so that they could address it.

I stayed at Caste Waikiki Grand in October 2011 and want to thank all of those dubious reviews. It was a fabulous hidden treasure among affordable hotels and if it wasn't for the cowards writing nasty things on this site i may not have got the room i did on level 9. Anyway this was my first trip to Hawaii, travelling alone and i booked the hotel for its location which is second to none and affordability at $79pn AU. What a surprise to find a safe, friendly hotel with a glam entrance foyer. Built in 1963, the architectural features of the bathroom reflected this era however everything was in excellent order. As a straight person i felt welcome at the hotel's gay bar and treasure the breathtaking photos taken from the 10th floor sundeck. Thank you Castle Waikiki Grand for a great holiday!

Getting to the room as soon as I opened the door it smelled like smoke and a homeless person. Not trying to be mean, but that is what best describes the smell. There were six blinds missing from the window mind you this place has been booked since late Feb. early March, and it wasn't until late Oct. until I arrived. The A/C was loud and did not work that well. The power went out twice. Room service came twice in the course of two weeks, and at check in I was told that they would be there four times. Ran out of T.P and had to go to the lobby and get it myself, as well as throw out my own trash. There was a point in the trip that the front desk had been called to ask about the room service and I was told they had already come, but the trash was still full the bed was fixed how I left it, and there was no new towels or T.P restocked. mins. later a room service attendant was sent up to do it. The pool was also dirty and didn't look to be used during the whole duration of this trip, it also smelled like an uncleaned bathroom in the pool area. The upside about this place is the location, but that is really about it, the staff were ok but I would not stay here again unless everywhere else is booked up.

This is a slight revision from my previous review. I wanted to word it a bit differently. To start, the Castle Waikiki Grand isn't a traditional hotel. The studios, one + bedrooms, and suites are privately owned condominiums. At least most of them are anyway. The decor, the appliances, and the furnishings in the rooms are the sole responsibility of the condo owner. Therefore some rooms are going to be nicer than others. I had a room on the 6th floor, that overlooked the Honolulu zoo. The property is directly across the street from the zoo. However there were no weird odors or loud noises. In the mornings I would sit on the lanai and watch the peach colored flamingos walk around. From the lanai, I had a fantastic view of Diamond Head and the ocean. To the east there was Diamond Head, and to the west was the ocean. I couldn't have asked for a better view. In the mornings and the evenings, watching the sun rise and set from the lanai was absolutely beautiful. My studio had been renovated like a year before, and it was very nice. I did not see one creepy crawler in my room. It was clean, roomy, had fairly new furnishings, had a decent sized lanai, a queen sized bed, a full kitchen (no oven), dishes, utensils, pots and pans, microwave, a full sized fridge, 25 inch flat screen television with cable. The kitchen counters were granite top, the bathroom was clean and nicely done., I paid around $100/night. I went to the local grocery store (I rented a car), and I prepared most of my breakfast and dinner meals in the room and had my meals on the lanai as I watched the various people walking by and the flamingos roam around their area at the zoo.Granted, it did get a little noisy at night, but the noise didn't go on all through the night. The building has a burger joint on the lobby floor, and an alternative bar on the 2nd floor, mainly for men, but this was not a problem. I was there alone for 5 days and did not have a problem coming or going. I did not see, or experience anything weird while I was there. Sure the building could probably use a paint job, but it certainly is in decent shape. There is also parking provided for a fee. As this is moreso like an Extended Stay type of hotel, maid service is not available everyday unless you pay a nominal fee. If I am not mistaken, after 5 days maid service is provided at no charge.In my opinion, if you want to save money, this is the way to go. Just be sure to inquire about the room prior to booking. Ask about the decor, and the condo owner in general. However, if you're one of those who like to stay at overpriced hotel chains and pay a ridiculous nightly rate just for the sake of saying that you did, be my guest. Sure, you get a few more perks with these higher priced chain hotels, but in my opinion, the extra that you're paying could be used for something else. Think about it, when you're on business or vacation, how much time do you actually spend in the room anyway? I like the Castle Waikiki Grand, I'm considering going back before the year is out.

review_body: By far the worst stay I have experienced in Hawaii. I could have stayed down the beach for the same rate and been treated like a guest in a hotel. Stayed 5 nights and they never made the room up once and had to argue the last evening for 5 minutes with a security guard for shampoo and soap for my last evening! I am shocked by the staff. They never once smiled. They seem to go out of their way to avoid eye contact with anyone entering the lobby, exiting from the elevator to the lobby, etc. They only look up if you stand at the counter. Wifi keep dropping service so ended up having tp go to Starbucks to send emails. First moring, I brought back a cup of coffee and a bagel from the Starbucks and sat in the lobby and as I began to place spread on my bagel, a man with a dustpan full of cigarette butts told me I had to leave as there is no eating or drinking in the lobby! I said that I was aguest in the hotel. He pointed to an obsecured sign and said "no food or drinks" you must go! I was shocked that i had to leave the lobby! The man stared at me untill I got into the elevator to go up to my room. The room was in great disrepair. The deadbolt did not latch but the worst was the A/C unit that sounded like a Boeing aircraft engine even on low. I never could silence it but I needed the cool air so I went 5 nights with little sleep. I tried to Iron the second morning, as their was an iron in the closet but no ironing board. I placed my shirt on the flat bedspread to make due and yep, you guessed it, stained my shirt as the irons sole plate was so filthy, it transfered onto my shirt. Honestly, it looked like a thrift store purchased iron. The location cannot be beat as it is right across from the zoo, right at the beach and the start of the great shopping area. By the way I am smoker, and the smoking area on the side of the hotel in the alley had a chain across it most of the time that said "sorry, area closed". I was totally mislead by reviews of this place. There are other nearby hotels that you can have coffee in their lobbies and I bet are better places to stay. Not customer centric at all!

Originally i was a little worried because of some of the reviews but it was awesome could not have asked for more. Our room was neat tidy and modern. Across the road from honolulu zoo and a short walk to diamond head. Also the number 8 bus avross the road takes you pretty much wherever you need to go. Great spot!! This was our honeymoon with our one year old son. This end is definately quieter then the centre of waikiki great for families. Will definately go back!!

We stayed at the Waikiki Grand hotel in unit 501 which was very smartly appointed with a lanai balcony, 27" flat panel LCD TV, kitchenette with a 2 burner range, microwave, toaster oven and a very nice apartment sized refrigerator. The kitchen and bathroom have granite counter tops, the floors were a very nice tile and the walls painted a relaxing butter color. Everything was very clean and well maintained.We were happy to see recycle bins on each floor for our plastic/glass bottles and cans.The property is located by the zoo and was very convenient to the beach, multiple dining options and a Starbucks. While we love Starbucks, since the unit has a coffee maker we saved money by making our own coffee and breakfast each morning and would go up to the rooftop deck to enjoy the view and eat our breakfast. We love to use public transportation and the bus stop for several major lines was right out front so that worked out great for us.The next time we go back we would definitely stay here again.

I stayed here for one week. The room is no frills, but decent enough - good sized and big bed. The main issue was that there were cockroaches (both big and small ones). I killed a bunch one night with my flip-flops. The next day I complained to the front desk, and they called out an exterminator. The cockroaches were gone for one night, but on the next night I did see one or two (the small ones); the big ones did not appear. I would assume the big boys would appear in a matter of time. I wouldn't want to deal with that on an on-going basis.Besides the roaches, there's pretty much no amenities. They say it's not really a hotel, but condos that are for rent.The big plus is that the hotel is very close to the beach and to other cool things to do (the zoo, the aquarium, Diamond Head, the Saturday farmers market). And it's pretty reasonable. Would I stay there again? No. I'd want to find a hotel with cleaner rooms, meaning no roaches, and more amenities for the guests.

FANTASTIC! FUN! UNIQUE! If you are any of those words listed above then this hotel is for you! This hotel is not for everyone though and that is ok! My partner and myself are low profile kind of travelers. We enjoy adventure but also a good deal. We could not pass up the fantastic deal at Waikiki Grand. The location is excellent (quieter and located at the end of Waikiki Beach right next door to the Honolulu Zoo)! They are an Eco friendly hotel which means they clean your room every 3 days! This worked well for us! Free in-room internet as well. Room 901 (which we stayed in) had a microwave, mini fridge, an electric top burner with pots and pans, silverware, dishes, cups, coffee maker (for KONA COFFEE). My suggestion: hit up one of the many local farmers markets located around town! Pick up some produce and then go fishing! Or, pick up some local fresh fish! A bottle of wine and dinner! Homemade Hawaii style! Kona coffee is much better than the Starbucks located right next door to the Waikiki Grand. Walk down the road and hit up Honolulu Coffee House instead! You will be happy you did so! If you are gay it is neat to know that Waikiki is gay friendly! YES! And they share the hotel with an excellent gay bar named, Hulas. Hit up the midday happy Mojito hour! You can sit in style and gaze at beautiful Diamond Head! Super close to Queens Beach(Gay beach) Great value for the money if you are low maintenance kind of people!

review_body: Honolulu is full of terrible hotels that look just GREAT on the internet and then turn out to be real stinkers. Honolulu is FULL of expensive hotels that are nice, as nice as any downtown Hilton or Marriott or Hyatt Regency but no more. Honolulu also has its helping of laughably silly expensive hotels that have opulent lobbies, overpriced restaurants and pool terraces with guards to keep out the rifraff. The Castle Waikiki Grand Hotel is none of these. Its pool is not worth the trouble, it is behind the hotel and ground level and surrounded by tall buildings so it gets no sun, no big deal, you dont need the pool. The Grand has no restaurant or hair salon or gift shop. It does house Honolulu's biggest and best gay bar as well as a GLBT clothing/trinket shop. What the Grand has is an awesome spot at the end of Waikiki Beach, less than one block from the sand and one entire side of the hotel and the front has a view of the ocean and the extensive Honolulu Zoo and surrounding lush parkland. You wont get a view like this anywhere else except maybe at the Parc Hotel next door.This place is a mix of owned/rented small studio condo units that are lived in and hotel rooms. The rooms are small but clean. This building is old and in same cases looks like it needs some paint here or there. The lanais are perfect for all day sun and I mean from 7am-5:30p, nothing gets in the way of the sun since there are no more tall buildings across from the hotel. There is high speed wireless internet that worked fine and cable TV with medium sized LCD TVs- I stayed in two rooms, both had nice TVs. Both rooms I was in had refrigerators and microwave ovens, one did have a 2 burner mini stove and sink, the other one did not. All rooms have A/C which you will need if the day is sunny.Dont count on quiet in Honolulu, there is always street noise but my room on the 9th floor was much quieter than the one on the 4th floor.The front desk closes at 10p so dont find yourself needing something after that! The Grand is within walking distance of all of Waikiki shopping and dining, its just right around the corner in either direction. For quick food there is a Teddy's Bigger Burger right downstairs, its a Hawaii based burger chain. Starbucks is next door, McDonalds, Subway and Burger King are minutes away. The International Marketplace is about 10 minutes walk and there is a pretty amazing food court with every kind of Asian food you can imagine from Vietnamese, Japanese, Chinese, Hawaiian, Korean, sea food of every kind and, well, much more. In addition Lu Lu's is a nice place with lots of fresh sea food and salads right next door. The Aston has a nice terrace restaurant around the corner and a liitle further down is the main shopping area where you can find such appalling restaurants as The Cheesecake Factory, Jimmy Buffets Margaritaville and Cheeseburger in Paradise- I always say that there is nothing better after a hot day in the sun than a big creamy slab of cheesecake!Anyway, chooses the Grand for a great value and a great location and you wont even notice that the room doors like like they may be about 40 years old!

All we wanted was a balcony with ocean views to sit, relax & enjoy our 2 week break from our 24/7 Holiday Resort Managers job. With the description of Sun deck penthouse 1006 at the Grand Hotel we thought we choose the perfect place!Unfortunately this was not the case; the Rental description describes the property - A Studio Condo with Ocean, mountain & city views with a balcony, as the picture shows. Beware it is not what you get.We arrived to a 4 wall room with one window that could not be opened because of the paper blinds, so no real day light nor fresh air.The first night was spent sleeping with the fan light on above our bed because it was faulty, the other fan light around the kitchen area did not work at all so when darkness came so did the kitchen! The owner who lives next door was very accommodating & had new fans on the property to install the following morning!I gave the owner all the cracked & unhygienic cups & plates to replace; no way could I use them, the cleaner was also called to clean the dirty toilet. The lift located outside our entry door was the passage way to the Sundeck & consequently the views, being Australian & needing fresh air we kept our entry door open, unfortunately everyone accessing the lift & sun deck could view are small room & all our belonging, to say we were disappointed is an understatement.Our first day in Hawaii was searching for alternative accommodation, unfortunately we paid upfront for 2 week at the Grand hotel & to our great disappointment no refund was offered after stating our case, so the holiday to Hawaii cost a small fortune in alternative accommodation. We stayed 1 week at the Grand Hotel then moved to the Pacific Beach Hotel for our 2nd week which was perfect for our requirements. Please be careful in descriptions of accommodation at the Grand Hotel, it is not as it seems & we do not recommend this place at all.

I was slightly nervous based on reviews about what I would walk into. I was prepped to ask for a different room. They gave me room 604, and when I opened the door, I was very pleased to find a very clean room. It wasn't huge by any means, but definitely comparable to a standard Marriott room on the mainland. The room had a king size bed, nice sized LCD TV, "okay" WiFi, microwave and good sized mini-fridge. If you're going with a family of 4, not the place to stay, but for 2, absolutely worth a stay. The staff at Hulas on the second floor was outstanding as well.

My wife and I booked this hotel through the Priceline Negotiator. We were a little concerned that we got the room for $53/night but we figured we could spend the money we saved on other things. When we got to the hotel it was in a very sketchy part of Waikiki (near the zoo). The guy at the front desk was not very friendly. We were assigned room 804. We knew before hand after reading some reviews that we would ask for a different room if we were not happy. We went up to the 8th floor and it looked like a run-down apartment building. In the room was a tiny double bed (supposed to be a queen). The bedspread was old and worn with holes in it. The ceiling was falling to pieces, the drapes were tattered, the carpet was disgusting, the furnishings were old, the tub was grungy and looked like it hadnt been cleaned in years, the fixtures were falling off and the room smelled like death. The clincher for us was the couch and stools in the room which were covered in BLOOD and "other bodily fluids" everywhere. We went back downstairs and told the desk clerk that there was no way we were sleeping in that room. He huffed and made i seem like we were being unreasonable in asking for another room. He gave us room 822 and said that was the only other room that was avaialble. We went back up to the 8th floor into the new room. This room was slightly better but not by much. It had a king bed with and old soiled mattress, the carpets were just as gross and the curtains had the same blood and "body fluid" stains as the frst room. The room was musty and the A/C didnt work. The room looked over the inner courtyard area which is surrounded in low income housing with some very unsavoury looking tenants. The only upside (if there is one) is that it had a flat screen tv. The window locks barely worked. By this time it was very late and we were tired from a long day of travel so we decided to stay the night and get another hotel in the morning. In the middle of the night the bed crashed through the frame and onto the floor. The noise from outside was very loud with crazies and druggies shouting at all hours of the night. I was itching all night and barely slept. We were up and checking out of that place at 6am. The new guy at the front desk made no effort to correct our stay nor did he apologize for the condition of the room. The only thing he said to us was to contact Priceline about a refund. It seems like they are well aware that this hotel is disgusting. We aren't usually picky when it comes to our accomodations but this is by far the worst place we have ever stayed. We went to the hotel a few doors down to use their internet access to book a room at the Hilton Hawaiian Village which was absolutely amazing! Do not stay here, spend the extra money and book a nice hotel, it saved our trip thats for sure.My only regret is that I forgot to take pictures to post with this review but all we could think about was getting the hell out of there.

Love this place. Make sure to book an updated room. Awesome location. Go out, have fun at the beach, hit Hula's and crash here. Nothing better for $89/night and this comes from a Ritz Carlton junkie. Just do it and have fun.

Stayed in Ste. 1005. The room was everything and more and the view was absolutely beautiful. The owner was friendly and easy to work with and he visited us to make sure everything was okay. Would definitely stay there. Be sure to bring a hairdryer as this is not an item that the unit has, but with a jacuzzi tub, beautiful tile and all the kitchen amenities, that was not an issue.

We really enjoy this casual hotel. It has a great location across from the Honolulu Zoo and you can walk to the wonderful Waikiki Beach in basically one minute. It's not a luxury property by any measurement but if you enjoy the day at the beach and use the room for sleeping, it's great. Our room 501 was a very clean small studio with a flat screen tv, nice tile flooring and even included a kichenette with Microwave.Hotel offers free internet access too:-) Downstairs, you can eat the best burgers in Honolulu at Teddy's. Only issue is limited parking availible for guests at $16.00 nightly charge.

I just returned from staying in this hotel with a friend, who rated it much lower than I did. It's definitely not luxurious or even a 4 star hotel, but I felt it was clean (no bugs or other creatures, which was a big plus to me) and fairly large/comfortable (after we upgraded to a suite). The very best thing about the hotel is the view, especially from the 10th floor, which was where our room was located. Our first room (#501) was tiny, almost claustrophobic - especially for 2people (we would have been miserable there). So we decided to upgrade to a suite (#1009) and had much more room, incl 2 bathrooms - one for each of us. My favorite thing to do was relaxing out on the lanai while looking at the ocean or Diamond Head; there was usually a nice breeze, and it was lovely (except when the construction started at 6am at two sites across the street, the Zoo and a nearby hotel). We had several problems w/our stay -- incl no free Wi-Fi or internet access in the room, even though it was advertised; having to change our parking space every day; and the curtains in the room were in shreds making it impossible to open them to allow the breeze to flow thru. When we reported these issues to Jason, the manager, he was very helpful, deleting the parking charges and cost of room upgrade from our bill, and refunding my friend's charges for accessing Wi-Fi. All in all, if a lovely view/proximity to beach/cleanliness are important to you and you don't need free Wi-Fi/internet access or all the little amenities you get at a nicer hotel, then I'd recommend this hotel. I'd give it a 5 or 6 on a scale of 1-10.

I booked this as a package deal. The photos looked great. It's not a 5 star but we didn't expect that. The room we got on the 6th floor was smelly and tiny. Very old and tattered. It felt like a large closet. We requested an upgrade and they gave us a suite on the 10th floor for an additional $40 per night. The suite was large with a great view from the deck. The deck was shared and there were constantly people stroling up and looking in our room. One person even asked how we got the room and how much we paid. It was very weird. As thougth she had wanted it but coulnd't have it. The paint in the room was cracking. The curtains were tattered and torn and the drawstrings did not work. Not even one of them. The were cheap and dinjy. Most of the windows didn't work properly or wouldn't open and the AC was not enough to cool the room. There were no closets but had a good size wardrobe cabinet. The doors were held shut by toilet paper shoved in the middle. Noise was aweful and construction next door started at 6:00am.They promised free WiFi and there was none. On top of that the staff didn't know anything about that service. I got a lot of "I don't knows" Even pluging into the roughter didn't work. I had to pay for an outside internet service that my wifi found. Parking was a nightmare. We had to change parking spaces 5 times in the 4 days we were there. Someone was always in our assigned space. We even got questioned by security about why & where we were parked.Good points: No Bed bugs.The manager was very nice, professional, and attentive. He refunded our money for the upgrade and reimbursed us for the wifi we paid for...that is if the refund show up on my credit statement. I sure hope so.The view was great from the top floor.Location was great. Close to everything.Bad points:Poorly maitained, smelly, bad parking facility, no one of knowlege on staff after 10:00pm., Old broken furniture, torn curtains, noisy, windows don't work. I was not happy at all.Oh, one more thing... There is an incredible wall picture in rm 1009. I't a beautiful lady and I couldn't take my eyes off of it. Pretty spooky. Loved it! It didn't make up for the rest though.

I've stayed more than a dozen times since 2001. Under new management, their late check-out policies are abysmal. Also, they should consider half-day rates for checkout by 10p. Most flights to mainland USA are red-eye flights and it would be nice to take a shower and relax before flying back overnight. This stay was an overnight layover on my USA-Asia trip.Great location since it's less than 200m to the beachfront and easy parking by the zoo across the street. Laundry facilities are pretty standard. I wouldn't recomment stays over 3 days since the apartments do not have much room to spread out your belongings. Spotty WiFi but every room (since 2005) has a physical broadband connection.Can't do much about mold in damp areas... afterall, it's the tropics and humid year round. Enclosed are pictures of room 710.
